original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: las bdag por khas mi len na nyes pa mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu des na'o //
translated: â€œ For this reasonâ€ is the reason why it is so.

analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes 'chad do // nus med rang bzhin med pas na //

original: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'phel dang 'grib pa dag kyang khyad par du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: â€œ Nor is there any increase or decreaseâ€ means that there is no distinction in the increase or decrease of desire, etc.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mtshungs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: â€œ How can there be a difference in the result?â€ means that there is a similarity of result.

analyzed: bad ka na la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin zhes 'brel to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of phlegm, etc. is the cause of desire, etc.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /

original: de 'phel ba dang 'grib pa na'o //
analyzed: de 'phel ba dang 'grib pa na'o //
translated: when they increase and decrease.

original: @181b gang gi tshe rang bzhin 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de'i tshe na bad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: @181b gang gi tshe rang bzhin 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de'i tshe na bad kan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi /

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ni yin no //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ni yin no //

analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid du thal ba bzlog par dka'o //

original: khyad par gzhan yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /

original: skyes bu so so la rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las lhag par 'gyur pa /
analyzed: skyes bu so so la rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las lhag par 'gyur pa /

translated: From what cause? means from the instrument of knowledge.

translated: It is related to the object.

analyzed: gang gi sgra la ltos kyang rgyu de las zhes khong nas phyung ste /
translated: Even if it depends on the word what, the cause is extracted from within.

analyzed: de nyid gang gi tshe sdang la sogs pa'i rgyu yang yin par nye bar dmigs so zhes sprel bar bya'o //

analyzed: yang na rgyu gang las zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'brel te /

translated: What specific modification is observed in dependence on the cause of desire and so on, such as wind and so on?

original: de'i che zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe gang gi sgra la ltos nas rgyu de zhes bya ba mdun du byas la /
analyzed: de'i che zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe gang gi sgra la ltos nas rgyu de zhes bya ba mdun du byas la /
translated: The word then depends on the word what, and the cause is brought forward.

original: thams cad kyi chos nyid bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi chos nyid bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The nature of all is connected.

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mkhris pa la sogs pa la ma nges ba'i phyir rang bzhin thams cad ma yin la /
translated: because attachment, etc. are not ascertained in bile, etc.

original: mkhris pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i khyad par yang 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhris pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i khyad par yang 'dod chags la sogs pa khyad par thams cad kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: and the distinctions in the location of bile, etc. would be the nature of all distinctions of attachment, etc.

original: 'khrul pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error is the same.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid du gsal ba'i rgyu des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid du gsal ba'i rgyu des na'o //
translated: Because of that reason, attachment, etc. are the same as the manifest elements.

original: ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na de yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na de yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: If you think that is not tenable, he says, that also is not tenable.

original: bad kan la sogs pa'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pa'i yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The distinctions in the transformation of phlegm, etc.

original: gal te rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par gang yang rung ba zhig rgyu nyid yin yang /
analyzed: gal te rlung la sogs pa'i khyad par gang yang rung ba zhig rgyu nyid yin yang /
translated: If any distinction of wind, etc. is the cause,

original: khyad par thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par thams cad 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: then all distinctions would not be endowed with all attachment, etc.

original: thams cad kyi tshe nges pa'i 'bras bu mthong bas rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe nges pa'i 'bras bu mthong bas rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: because the effect is ascertained at all times, it should be inferred.

original: des pa'i khyad par gyi lhan cig byed ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des pa'i khyad par gyi lhan cig byed ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is the special concomitant cause of the gentle.

original: 'o na nges pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par de ni goms pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'o na nges pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par de ni goms pa kho na yin te /
translated: But if you say that the cause of the ascertainment is the special concomitant cause, then that is simply habituation,

original: de'i dbye ba las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid ni der 'gyur pas khyab pa yin pas ;
translated: Since the result is pervaded by that,

original: de dang 'gal ba der 'gyur bas mi 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba der 'gyur bas mi 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it were unchanging, it would not be the effect of that, because it would be contrary to that.

original: gal te lus 'ba' zhig gi 'bras bu nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te lus 'ba' zhig gi 'bras bu nyid yin na /
translated: If it were the effect of the body alone,

original: de ltar ma 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de ltar ma 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: it would not be like that.

original: 'on kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni don lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus kyi 'bras bu yin pas lus tha mi dad kyang don tha dad pas rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni don lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus kyi 'bras bu yin pas lus tha mi dad kyang don tha dad pas rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: However, since mental consciousness is the effect of the body that is the co-creator of the object, it is not different from the body, but it is different from the object, so it changes.

original: des na de'i tshe tshogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa de ni de'i 'bras bu kho na'o snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rnam par rtog pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na de'i tshe tshogs pa tha dad pas tha dad pa de ni de'i 'bras bu kho na'o snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rnam par rtog pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, at that time, the difference due to the difference in the collection is only the effect of that. Anticipating this doubt, he says conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yul la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yul la mi ltos pa'i phyir /

original: lus tsam gyi rgyu can du khas mi len na 'gal bar byad pa grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus tsam gyi rgyu can du khas mi len na 'gal bar byad pa grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: gang yang lus nyid de'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yang lus nyid de'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And also, the body itself is its cause. This is the meaning.

original: gang yang lus nyid de'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba phyogs snga mar bkod pa de lta na yang rang bzhin yin pa zhes rjes su brjod pa ni nyes pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang lus nyid de'i rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba phyogs snga mar bkod pa de lta na yang rang bzhin yin pa zhes rjes su brjod pa ni nyes pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the opponent posits the body as the cause of that, the response â€œit would be its intrinsic natureâ€ is the same fault.

original: ci'i phyir snyam na rgyu'am zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na rgyu'am zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni lus ma 'gyur rang bzhin mtshungs pa nyid ma yin na'o //

analyzed: gzugs sogs bzhin du zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i phyir lus la brten pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus kyi rgyu can yin na lus tha mi dad par de tha dad pa mthong ba med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin pa'o //
translated: If the mental consciousness were the bodyâ€™s cause, then, since the body would not be different, it would not be seen to be different.

original: de lta na bag chags sad pa rgyu nyid yin na lus tha mi dad kyang de tha dad pa las de tha dad pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni gang gi tshe lus @193a * //
analyzed: de lta na bag chags sad pa rgyu nyid yin na lus tha mi dad kyang de tha dad pa las de tha dad pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni gang gi tshe lus @193a * //

original: la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œLaâ€ means â€œif.â€

analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa gang la bag chags sad pa nyid kyi rgyu yod pa'i shes pa de ni 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin pa de'i tshe ste /

analyzed: gang dang de ni rtag tu 'brel pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i tshe ni rgyu des na 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'ga' zhig ltar 'gyur ba yin te /

analyzed: rang bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: but not naturally.

original: yang na gang gi tshe shes pa 'ba' zhig skye bar 'dod pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig gi bag chags sad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang na gang gi tshe shes pa 'ba' zhig skye bar 'dod pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig gi bag chags sad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de'i tshe /

original: rgyu des na 'ga' zhig kho nar 'gyur pa yin no ;
analyzed: rgyu des na 'ga' zhig kho nar 'gyur pa yin no ;

original: / rnam par bshad pa byed pas ni lus la ltos med par zhes khyad par bkag pas lhag ma khas blangs pa'i phyir bag chags sad pa la rgyu 'ga' zhig la ltos dgos pa'i rgyu des skyes bu 'ga' zhig gi shes pa dus 'ga' zhig gi tshe /

analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya bar lus rgyu yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: lus rgyu yin na ni rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gyur te /

original: gang rnam par 'gyur bas nges par rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa de nye bar len par 'dod par bya ba yin no zhes shes pa rgyu yin pa'i gtan tshigs yang gzhan brjod pa ni rnam shes min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir 'khor ba bar gyur par ni ma zad kyi /

translated: This is the system of the SÄá¹ƒkhya,

analyzed: 'di @193b ni rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni rgyu ni rnam brgyar zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo gang zhig rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo tha dad pa de ni sngar nus pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa la med do //

translated: If the other world is just that,

original: de lta bu'i nus pa zhes smras so //

original: rtsva mchog gi rtse'i glang po che bzhin du 'o ma la zho la sogs pa ma mthong ba khas len par gsal pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //

translated: It is clear that you accept that milk is not seen in the tip of a blade of grass or in a camelâ€™s hump, just as yogurt and so on are not seen in milk.

translated: â€œ From another natureâ€ is the opponentâ€™s doubt.

analyzed: de nyid ni yul 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: â€œ That itselfâ€ is the nature of apprehending objects and so on.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mi brjod snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mi brjod snyam na /
translated: Why is it not called that?

original: rnam shes las gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam shes las gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /

original: yul 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: yul 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid las so //

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin yod pas so //

original: de zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //

original: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po thams cad rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that all things are endowed with the potency of consciousness.ğŸ”½Even though consciousness is the appropriator, it is not established that there is a world beyond.

analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'o // de'i zhes bya ba ni lan te ma la sogs pa de'i'o //
translated: That is consciousness.ğŸ”½â€œItsâ€ refers to the reply.

original: pha yin zhes bya ba las /

original: sa bon las skyes ba'i chu shing yang /

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang rung bzhes bya ba'i nges par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: snga na med pa 'byung ba las zhes @194b bya ba'o //
translated: â€œFrom what has not yet arisenâ€ means â€œfrom what has not yet come into existence.â€

analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags tsam gyi bdag nyid dam 'bras bu ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na lus kyi rnam pa can gyi yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /

original: 'byung ba'i dag las zhes bya ba'o//

analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das ba'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œBy that aloneâ€ means that the nature of the body is the nature of the elements, or it does not go beyond the nature of the elements.

translated: because they are pervaded by the difference of the latter, just like the nature of a living being.ğŸ”½But if you think that the difference of the elements that have the form of the body is inferred from the difference of attachment, etc., and that attachment is not the same,

analyzed: gal te 'byung khyad las min no // zhes bya ba'o // des na zhes bya ba ni khyad bar yod pa na'o //

original: de tsam las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam las skye ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de @195a * //

original: lha ma yin te /

analyzed: 'phel 'grib yod pas so //

original: snga na med pa 'byung ba la //

analyzed: chags sogs nges med 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gsum gyis gtsor bya ba'i don 'chad pa ni gang brjod pa la /

analyzed: de la ci zhig brtsad snyam na /

original: sa la sogs pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa zhes sbyar ro //

translated: â€œ From a special causeâ€ means that it is.

analyzed: tha dad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa che rim dang ldan pa'o //

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
translated: â€œ In the same wayâ€ means as it is different.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dang ldan na yang ngo //

analyzed: rgyu nyid kyi phyir gang yin pa de ni mi ldog ste brtag pa'i phyir ro //

translated: â€œ Therefore, desire, etc., are not exhaustedâ€ is the meaning of the doubt.

analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad par med na spyi nyid ci ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: rgyud gzhan la gnas pa ni rgyud gzhan gyi 'dod chags kyi ma yin no snyam na /

analyzed: brjod pa 'dod chags kyi lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba nyid las 'byung ba yin la /

analyzed: rgyu'i phyir yang de nyid la brjod pa yin no //

analyzed: gal te 'di ni 'byung ba'i bdag nyid las ma 'das phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu zin pa nyid ma yin nam yin te /
translated: Isnâ€™t it the case that this doubt has already been addressed by the statement, â€œBecause it does not transcend the nature of the primary elementsâ€?

analyzed: sngar ni 'dod chags la 'grib pa'i na rims yod pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal ba'i lan du 'byung ba'i bdag las ma 'das phyir zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu ba yin la /
translated: It is true that this was stated earlier, but it was stated as a response to the consequence that if desire exists, then it would follow that someone would be free from attachment because desire would be subject to increase and decrease.

analyzed: da ltar ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu la 'grib pa'i na rims yod pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig de dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal ba la lan gal te chags sogs zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: The response to this is, â€œIf attachment, etc. . . . â€

original: des na dogs pa khyad par yod do //
analyzed: des na dogs pa khyad par yod do //
translated: Thus, there is a difference in the objection.

original: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa'i mtha' la tha dad pa med kyang skyon ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas /ğŸ”½bdag nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu can gyi //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa'i mtha' la tha dad pa med kyang skyon ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas / bdag nyid 'dra ba'i rgyu can gyi //
translated: Therefore, thinking that there is no fault even though there is no difference in the conclusion,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, â€œThe cause of the similarity of the self . . . â€

original: bdag nyid 'dra ba ni lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba tsam mo //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dra ba ni lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba tsam mo //
translated: The similarity of the self is the mere elements that have the form of the body.ğŸ”½Even though the cause is the same,

original: de ltar rgyu mtshungs pa nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la de ltar ni de tshe'i don te mtshungs pa ni 'byung ba tsam du'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu mtshungs pa nyid yin na yang zhes bya ba la de ltar ni de tshe'i don te mtshungs pa ni 'byung ba tsam du'o //
translated: the meaning of â€œeven thoughâ€ is that the cause is the same in being mere elements.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa nyid yin yang 'bras bu mi mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa nyid yin yang 'bras bu mi mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even though the cause is the same, the effect is not the same.

original: rgyu 'dra ba'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œThe cause of the similarityâ€ is stated.

original: gal te 'byung ba khyad par mi ba'i 'bras su khyad par can du 'gyur na ni 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te rgyu ma mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba khyad par mi ba'i 'bras su khyad par can du 'gyur na ni 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te rgyu ma mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the effect were different from the elements, it would not be the effect of the elements.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa des 'byung ba tsam de'i'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa des 'byung ba tsam de'i'o //
translated: The mere elements are of that, i.e., of desire, etc.

original: ci phyir snyam na de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes gsungs so //ğŸ”½gang gi phyir da ltar rgyu khyad par med pa'i 'bras bu khyad par dang ldan par mi 'thad /
analyzed: ci phyir snyam na de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang zhes gsungs so // gang gi phyir da ltar rgyu khyad par med pa'i 'bras bu khyad par dang ldan par mi 'thad /
translated: Why? Because of its conformity with that.ğŸ”½Because it is not tenable that the effect has a difference when the cause is without difference.

original: 'on kyang rgyu khyad par yod pa nyid na yin pa de'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gang la zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i khyad par ram /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu khyad par yod pa nyid na yin pa de'i phyir ro // gang la zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i khyad par ram /
translated: But when there is a difference in the cause, there is a difference in the effect.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la'o //
translated: â€œIn whatâ€ refers to the difference in the elements, or to desire, etc.

original: ci ltar med par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar med par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How could there be no difference?

original: 'grib pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'grib pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the difference in the decrease.

original: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What kind of decrease?

original: dkar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The decrease of white, etc.

original: dper na / dkar po la sogs pa la na rims yod pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / dkar po la sogs pa la na rims yod pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: is not absent because of the presence of fever,

original: 'dod chags kyi rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rgyu yang yin no //
translated: so also is the cause of passion.

original: yang na mtshungs pa'i phyir @196a * //
analyzed: yang na mtshungs pa'i phyir @196a * //
translated: Or, because of similarity.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med pa la 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi 'byung ba tsam gyis bskyed par bya bar 'dra ba'i phyir mi nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med pa la 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi 'byung ba tsam gyis bskyed par bya bar 'dra ba'i phyir mi nyams par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Not only because of the absence of a reason, but also because of similarity in being produced by mere elements, it would not deteriorate.

original: 'di nyid la dpe brjod pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la dpe brjod pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to illustrate this very point, he asks, Why?

original: lan du mtshungs bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid ba lang nyid dam /
analyzed: lan du mtshungs bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // mtshungs pa'i bdag nyid ba lang nyid dam /
translated: The answer is, Because of similarity, etc.

original: ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa las byung ba'i ba lang gi shes pa ni khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa las byung ba'i ba lang gi shes pa ni khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: The consciousness of a cow, which arises from the exclusion of non-cow, is not different.

original: sa la sogs pa 'dir yang srog chags nyid la sogs pa ni khyad par gyi rim pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'dir yang srog chags nyid la sogs pa ni khyad par gyi rim pa yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Or, in this case, earth, etc., do not have a different order of life, etc.

original: dpe gzhan yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe gzhan yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the example is different.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i lta ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'i dpe nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i lta ba la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'i dpe nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With respect to the Lokayata view means that the example is appropriate, that is, the meaning of is.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore means in conclusion.

original: 'grib pa yod na ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i mjug sdud do //
analyzed: 'grib pa yod na ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i mjug sdud do //
translated: If there is a decrease means that it concludes the previous section.

original: gal te na rims dang ldan pa'i chos can la gnas pa na shin du chud par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te na rims dang ldan pa'i chos can la gnas pa na shin du chud par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If it is so, then it is not the case that when one who possesses fever abides, the fever is completely destroyed.

original: mi gnas pa nyid na dro ba ldog pa ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½des na na rims dang ldan pa ni gtan med par 'gyur bas ma khyab ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa nyid na dro ba ldog pa ni ma yin no // des na na rims dang ldan pa ni gtan med par 'gyur bas ma khyab ste /

analyzed: mi 'chad pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the heat of the fire is not interrupted when it is being transmitted, so too the form of the body is not interrupted when desire, etc. are being transmitted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'chad ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chad ba srid pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gal te res 'ga' 'dod chags kyi nus pa ni mi 'chad pa la ma yin snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni nus pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that sometimes the potency of desire is not interrupted, he says, â€œThe potency of desire, etc. is not something different from desire, etc.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: â€ â€œIt is notâ€ means it is not so.

original: ga las she na nus pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: ga las she na nus pa zhes smos so //
translated: Why is that? He says, â€œThe potency of desire, etc. is not something different from desire, etc.â€

original: nus pa ni 'dod chags las don gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: nus pa ni 'dod chags las don gzhan nyid do //
translated: The potency of desire is not something different from desire.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½des na de rgyun ma chad kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa mchad pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o // des na de rgyun ma chad kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa mchad pa ni ma yin no zhes dgongs ba'o //
translated: â€œattachment, etc.â€ğŸ”½Thus, even though the continuum of attachment, etc. is not severed, the attachment, etc. are severed.

analyzed: nus pa yin no cog ni mi 'chad pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni nus pa yang zhes bya ba'o //

original: la lar ni til mar gyis byug pa'i sa bon la'o //
analyzed: la lar ni til mar gyis byug pa'i sa bon la'o //
translated: In some cases, the seed is anointed with oil.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nus pa 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nus pa 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, the capacity for attachment, etc. is severed in the elements that have the form of the body.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags pa med kyang lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba rnams yod pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa'i ci bshad ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dod chags pa med kyang lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba rnams yod pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa'i ci bshad ce na /
translated: Since that is the reason why the elements that have the form of the body exist even though there is no attachment, the author of the PramaÌ„nï¬ ava states:

original: nges min zhes smos so //
analyzed: nges min zhes smos so //
translated: â€œSince there is no certainty, etc.â€

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
translated: â€œAttachment, etc.â€ refers to the context.

analyzed: ci ltar dkar po la sogs pa gang rung zhig nyams kyang gdon ma za bar gang rung zhig tu 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas gzugs sogs bzhin du zhes gsungs so //

translated: The meaning of â€œcertaintyâ€ is that even without another, there is a nature of some other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag lus kyi rnam pa can gyi 'byung ba dang dbyer med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: gal te lus kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa med na mi 'byung pa ma yin nam snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te mtshungs she na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIf it is the sameâ€ is the question.

original: mi na zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mi na zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: â€œIt is not soâ€ is the refutation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir lus tsam 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams lhan cig 'byung ba gang yin pa der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus tsam 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams lhan cig 'byung ba gang yin pa der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that attachment and so on would arise simultaneously with the body alone.

analyzed: 'di yang / rgyu ni nye bar phyir blo rnams kun thams cad kho na skye @198b bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don rtogs par dgongs nas /
translated: Also, the meaning of the statement â€œall minds arise from their own causes aloneâ€ is understood to be that

analyzed: lus dang lhan cig skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba skabs kyis skye ba ni 'byung ba yin pas der thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de med kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa med kyang ngo //
translated: Even though that does not exist means even though attachment and so on do not exist.ğŸ”½The meaning of the statement â€œthe primary elements do not exist without form and so onâ€ is understood to be that

analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa nyid 'byung ba dang rnam par dbyer med pa yin gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, form and so on are inseparable from the primary elements, but attachment and so on are not.

analyzed: gal te de mtshungs she na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: der yang ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: â€œThereâ€ refers to desire, etc.

original: de lta bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang rnam par dbyer med par gnas pa nyid du mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang rnam par dbyer med par gnas pa nyid du mtshungs pa'o //
translated: â€œJust the sameâ€ means that it is the same in that it abides without being separated from the elements.

original: min zhes bya ba de'i rnam par 'grel pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba de'i rnam par 'grel pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on â€œnoâ€ is â€œthat is not so.â€

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams lus dang lhan cig 'byung ba nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Desire, etc. would be definitely simultaneous with the body.

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa brjod pa'o //
translated: â€œDesire, etc.â€ is a reversal of the order of the words.

analyzed: thams cad kyi tsho zhes bya ba ni bdag med ba bsgom pa la sogs pa btang snyoms su gnas par srid pa na'o //

analyzed: da ni rnam par dbyer med pa'i don tha mi dad pa'i don to zhes 'chad pa ni /

original: 'byung ba chen po tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œMere great elementsâ€ means that the great elements are the cause of form, etc.

original: smra ba 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams kyi'o //ğŸ”½gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las tha dad par ma yin pa des na rnam par dbye ba med pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin te /
analyzed: smra ba 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams kyi'o // gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba las tha dad par ma yin pa des na rnam par dbye ba med pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin te /

analyzed: lus dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Since form, etc. are not different from the great elements, they are inseparable, i.e., co-originate, like the body and form, etc. One should understand that desire, etc. are also like this.

analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang yang rtag tu ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like form, etc., desire, etc. would always be present.

original: gal te yul dang dbang po la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nye ba can gyi lus ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gal te yul dang dbang po la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nye ba can gyi lus ni rnam par shes pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If the body, which is the cause of desire, etc., is the collection of the sense-faculties, objects, etc., which are the co-operating conditions, then the body is the cause of desire, etc., just like consciousness.

analyzed: gal te yul gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o // 'dod chags la sogs ba ni /
translated: because it is the cause of the object.

analyzed: @199a * // bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa rnams la 'byung gi /

original: dmigs pa tsam la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam la ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise in relation to mere objects.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las 'byung ba ni yul gyi dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yul yin phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags las 'byung ba ni yul gyi dbang gis 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni rnam par rtog pa yul yin phyir zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'o na bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i skye gnas kyi bag chags te lus dang lhan cig pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i skye gnas kyi bag chags te lus dang lhan cig pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa /
translated: If you think that the latent imprints of the views of self and mine are simultaneous with the body,

original: skal mnyam de 'dra ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skal mnyam de 'dra ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir te /

original: 'jig rten pha rol na bsnyon pa'i phyogs la med pa'i phyir lus tsam las byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nges pa zhes bya ba res 'ga' mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid can du mi 'gyur /

analyzed: 'on kyang lus 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'am gyi sgras ni skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ltos nas sdud pa'o //
translated: The word or in the root text indicates that it would arise in dependence on that.

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nges pa zhes bya ba re re skye ba 'am brjod pa'i rang bzhin gyi nges pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Or attachment and so on would not be called definite, that is, they would not have the nature of arising individually or in combination, because they would lack homogeneous cause.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi srid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: yang na 'dod chags las sogs pa'i blo rnam pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa'i rgyu ni nye phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, the mind that is born from attachment and so on would occur in every way. The reason is stated: â€œbecause of proximity.â€

original: de med par zhes bya ba ni yul med par ro //
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba ni yul med par ro //
translated: â€œWithout thatâ€ means without the object.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ste skye ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ste skye ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment and so on occur, because the experience of birth is produced.

original: 'o na bag chags nyid rgyu yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na bag chags nyid rgyu yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But then the latent impressions themselves would be the cause.

analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de 'dod na ni 'jig rten gzhan grub par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //

analyzed: gang gi phyir yul gyi stobs la sogs pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: The reason is stated: â€œbecause attachment and so on do not occur from the power of the object and so on.â€

original: de med pa'i phyir ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œWithout thatâ€ means without the cause of similar type.

original: res 'ga' mi skye bar mi 'gyur te 'on kyang gtan du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' mi skye bar mi 'gyur te 'on kyang gtan du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not sometimes not be produced. Rather, they would always be produced.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa re re skye ba las sam /

original: 'dod chags la sogs thams cad skye ba las 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs thams cad skye ba las 'gyur /
translated: Or from the arising of all attachment, etc.

original: de la re zhig dang po mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas @199b brjod pa ni des na nges par lus 'dod chags la sogs pa re re dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas @199b brjod pa ni des na nges par lus 'dod chags la sogs pa re re dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As for that, first of all, the conclusion is stated: â€œTherefore, the body is definitely not the cause of attachment, etc., each or all together.â€

original: gnyis pa gsal bar byed pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa gsal bar byed pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is the clarification: â€œOr, if you think that the body is the cause of attachment, etc., each or all together, then, in that case, the body would be the cause of attachment, etc., even before the arising of attachment, etc.â€

original: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te gang gis zhes bya ba'o//ğŸ”½yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gang gis so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te gang gis zhes bya ba'o// yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gang gis so //
translated: â€œAll togetherâ€ means that attachment, etc., would sometimes be intermittent.

original: gal te yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang lus tsam las 'byung ba'i tshe'i lus bzhin du thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir cig car ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par yang lus tsam las 'byung ba'i tshe'i lus bzhin du thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir cig car ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the objection is: â€œIf you think that the body is the cause of attachment, etc., each or all together, then, in that case, the body would be the cause of attachment, etc., even before the arising of attachment, etc.â€

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mi yongs su gyur pa yod pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mi yongs su gyur pa yod pas so //
translated: â€œBy whatâ€ refers to the existence of a transformation of the person.

original: de dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œThoseâ€ refers to desire, etc.ğŸ”½â€œIn that wayâ€ means sometimes.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba ni res 'ga' de'i ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba ni res 'ga' de'i ni lus kyi'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the body.

original: de bas na 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, desire is produced.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i rim pa mthong ba las /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i rim pa mthong ba las /
translated: If the order of the effect is seen,

original: rgyu'am rgyu'i rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang rtogs pa ma yin snyam du dogs pa ni gang rung las she na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'am rgyu'i rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang rtogs pa ma yin snyam du dogs pa ni gang rung las she na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one might suspect that the cause or some cause is not understood.ğŸ”½The response is: â€œIt is not the case that the cause of that is understood at all times, because something is possible at some time.â€ğŸ”½The response is: â€œIt is not the case that the cause of that is understood at all times, because something is possible at some time.â€

original: gang yang rung ba zhig ni thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir de'i rgyu can yang thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig ni thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir de'i rgyu can yang thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig kun tshe'ang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œAt some timeâ€ means at some time.

analyzed: kun tshe'ang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi rgyu can ni thams cad kyi tshe 'byung par 'gyur ro //
translated: â€œAt all timesâ€ means the cause of all is understood at all times.

original: gal te ma mthong bas mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because it is not seen,ğŸ”½then it would follow that everything is not so at all times because it is not seen.

analyzed: rgyu med pas thams cad thams cad kyi tshe mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by â€œat all.â€

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par ni rgyu nges pa med par yin pa'i phyir rtag tu yod par 'gyur bar brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su gyur ba'i khyad par ni rgyu nges pa med par yin pa'i phyir rtag tu yod par 'gyur bar brjod do //
translated: The transformation is said to be always present because the cause is not definite.

original: de la gal te ma mthong ba nyid lan yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te ma mthong ba nyid lan yin na /
translated: If you say that the reason is not seen,

original: de'i tshe 'ga' yang rgyud dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'ga' yang rgyud dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then nothing would have a continuum,

original: thams cad du de bsnyen par bya nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du de bsnyen par bya nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it would be possible to approach everything.

original: gal te yang mthong ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa nyid la byed pa'i sa bon spangs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i khyad yin par khas len na de'i tshe du ba yang mes bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang mthong ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa nyid la byed pa'i sa bon spangs nas 'dod chags la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i khyad yin par khas len na de'i tshe du ba yang mes bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if you accept that the transformation of the cause is the specific cause of attachment and so on, which is the seed of incorrect perception, then smoke would not be generated by fire.

original: thams cad las 'byung ba yang ma yin te //
analyzed: thams cad las 'byung ba yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor does it arise from everything,

original: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /

original: @200a * // me min las kyang du ba 'byung //
analyzed: @200a * // me min las kyang du ba 'byung //
translated: Smoke arises from what is not fire.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni me ma yin ba las byung ba'i du ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni me ma yin ba las byung ba'i du ba la'o //
translated: There, in the smoke that arises from what is not fire,ğŸ”½the cause is not ascertained.

original: rgyu med pa'i du ba la yang mthong ba'i stobs kyi yul la sogs pa ma nges par 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni dngos po rgyu med pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½der yang zhes bya ba ni du ba la'o de'i phyir de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa yad thams cad kyi rgyu can nam /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i du ba la yang mthong ba'i stobs kyi yul la sogs pa ma nges par 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni dngos po rgyu med pa la yang zhes bya ba'o // der yang zhes bya ba ni du ba la'o de'i phyir de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa yad thams cad kyi rgyu can nam /
translated: In the smoke that arises without a cause, the object, etc. are not ascertained by the power of seeing. This is what is said.ğŸ”½In that, in the smoke,

original: rgyu med pa can du 'gyur gyi lus kyi rgyu can ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½nges pa ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par ram /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can du 'gyur gyi lus kyi rgyu can ni ma yin no // nges pa ni yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par ram /
translated: therefore, in this way, desire, etc. would have all things as their cause or would be without a cause, but they are not the cause of the body.ğŸ”½Ascertainment is a difference in transformation or a change from seeing.

original: mthong ba las 'gyur ba yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: mthong ba las 'gyur ba yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: This is the position.

original: gal te yang ma nges pa'i rgyu can nyid kyis rtag tu yod par thal ba las /
analyzed: gal te yang ma nges pa'i rgyu can nyid kyis rtag tu yod par thal ba las /
translated: If, on the other hand, the reason for the uncertainty is that it follows that it would always exist,

original: ma mthong ba nyid lan yin pa de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba gang yin pa de kho na yod pa yin no zhes gzhan gyis khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba nyid lan yin pa de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du mthong ba gang yin pa de kho na yod pa yin no zhes gzhan gyis khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: de lta na yang gnyis su med pa nyid rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, non-duality would be established.ğŸ”½Thus, without effort, all conventions would be destroyed.

original: des na 'bad pa med par tha snyad mtha' dag rnam par zhig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni mthong ba tsam la brten pa ni yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: des na 'bad pa med par tha snyad mtha' dag rnam par zhig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni mthong ba tsam la brten pa ni yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: To say this is to cling to existence based on mere seeing.

original: de ltar byed na de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad kyir mthong ba ni gnyis su med pa kho na yin gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byed na de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad kyir mthong ba ni gnyis su med pa kho na yin gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If one acts in this way, then seeing in any way is non-dual, but not effect and so on.ğŸ”½If that is so, what is undesirable?

original: de lta yin na mi 'dod pa ci yod snyam na 'dir ni zhes smos te gnyis med du gyur na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na mi 'dod pa ci yod snyam na 'dir ni zhes smos te gnyis med du gyur na'o //
translated: Here, if it becomes non-dual, then it is not seen.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The conventions of the characteristics of engagement and disengagement, or the characteristics of the conceptual thoughts that establish causes and effects, would be destroyed.

original: 'on te 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu can nyid du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu can nyid du mthong ba yin no //

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i khyad par can gyi rang rig pas ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha snyad kyi ming can grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i khyad par can gyi rang rig pas ni rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha snyad kyi ming can grub pa yin te /
translated: By means of reflexive awareness, which has the special quality of positive and negative concomitance, the conceptual thoughts of cause and so on, which are conventionally designated as names, are established.

original: des ni rgyu la sogs pa grub pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: des ni rgyu la sogs pa grub pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Thinking that this establishes cause and so on, the opponentâ€™s objection is anticipated and responded to:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas chags pa'i rgyu can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas chags pa'i rgyu can yin gyi /
translated: Desire and so on have the cause of attachment, which is the apprehension of â€œIâ€ and â€œmine.â€

original: lus kyi rgyu can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu can ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not have the body as their cause.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te tha snyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is understood in this way, it is said that â€œif it is conventionally designated as a name.â€

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dor bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dor bar nus pa'o //
translated: â€œOtherwiseâ€ means that it would be possible to discard it.

original: gal te skye ba dang po la sogs par rang rig pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu can nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi 'das pa'i @200b bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas chags pa'i rgyu can du ni ma yin
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang po la sogs par rang rig pa las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas 'dod chags la sogs pa lus kyi rgyu can nyid du rtogs pa yin gyi 'das pa'i @200b bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas chags pa'i rgyu can du ni ma yin
translated: If you think that in the first birth and so on, desire and so on are understood to be caused by the body through conceptual thought arising from reflexive awareness, but not to be caused by attachment to the past self and mine,

original: no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: then to anticipate that, he says:

original: ci ltar 'ga' zhig tu du ba me'i rgyu can du mthong nas /
analyzed: ci ltar 'ga' zhig tu du ba me'i rgyu can du mthong nas /
translated: Just as in some cases, having seen smoke as the cause of fire,

original: gzhan du me ma mthong yang de'i rgyu can du rig pa de bzhin du 'di yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan du me ma mthong yang de'i rgyu can du rig pa de bzhin du 'di yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: even though fire is not seen elsewhere, it is known to be its cause, so it should be seen here as well.

original: nges pa de ltar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa de ltar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the certainty is established in that way, it is said â€œjust as.â€

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The word â€œand so onâ€ also includes momentariness and so on.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa'o //
translated: â€œJust soâ€ means established by inference.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ci ltar zhes bya ba ni mi bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ci ltar zhes bya ba ni mi bya ba kho na'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ means the inference. â€œJust asâ€ means it should not be done.

original: gal te khyab pa med na mi 'byung mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ma mthong pa la yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: gal te khyab pa med na mi 'byung mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ma mthong pa la yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin /
translated: If there is no pervasion, then inference is not a valid means of knowledge with regard to what is not directly perceived, because it does not occur without it.ğŸ”½The valid means of knowledge of that is based on just that.

original: de'i tshad ma ni de tsam gyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas tha dad shes dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i tshad ma ni de tsam gyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas tha dad shes dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having anticipated this doubt, he says, â€œThe cognition of difference.â€

original: shes pa don gyi tha dad pa mngon sum gyis ma grub la /
analyzed: shes pa don gyi tha dad pa mngon sum gyis ma grub la /
translated: The difference of cognition from the object is not established by direct perception.

original: sngon po la sogs pas byas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pas byas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is it made by blue, etc.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bor tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bor tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it different in the nature of the prior and subsequent.

original: 'di ltar med na mi 'byung ba ni bdag nyid nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar med na mi 'byung ba ni bdag nyid nyams su myong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa las khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the non-occurrence without it is to be understood from the conception that arises from oneâ€™s own experience.

original: des rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam pa'i mngon par rlom pa khas mi len na ni khyad par dang bral ba dang rig pa tsam du 'gyur na /
analyzed: des rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam pa'i mngon par rlom pa khas mi len na ni khyad par dang bral ba dang rig pa tsam du 'gyur na /
translated: If one does not accept the conceit â€œIt is to be realized by that,â€ then it would be devoid of distinction and mere awareness.

original: de la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang sngon po dang gzhan la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang sngon po dang gzhan la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba srid pa ma yin no //
translated: In that, the differentiation of apprehended object and apprehending subject, blue and yellow, etc. is not possible.

original: 'o na rnam par dbye ba ga las yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par dbye ba ga las yin snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then how is differentiation possible?

original: des na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says, â€œbecause of that.â€

original: rang rig pa la phyis rjes su dpog pas na rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa la phyis rjes su dpog pas na rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Since it is inferred later on the basis of reflexive awareness, it is a conceptual cognition that is an inference.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin te byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin te byas pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is an inference because it is the cause of inference, like a syllogism.

original: tha snyad thams cad byas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad byas zhes bya ba la /
translated: All conventions are made.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad dam rtags nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tha snyad byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad dam rtags nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tha snyad byas pa yin no //
translated: The convention of engagement and disengagement, or the convention of inference that is preceded by the ascertainment of a reason, is made.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa de ltar yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa de ltar yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because of that, it is like that.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Inference is as before.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar mthong ba dor ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar mthong ba dor ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that seeing is abandoned for that reason.ğŸ”½What is seen and what is not seen,

original: gang dag ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba nas /
translated: and what is confused about that,ğŸ”½is not seen, is not seen,

original: ci bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ci bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar de gsal ba yin no //
translated: and is confused, respectively.

original: mthong ba ni me tog phreng dang tsandan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni me tog phreng dang tsandan la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is seen is garlands, sandalwood, etc.

original: ma mthong ba ni 'jig @201a * //ğŸ”½rten pha rol la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni 'jig @201a * // rten pha rol la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is not seen is the next world, etc.

original: rmongs pa ni yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni yod par lta ba'o //
translated: What is confused is the view of existence.

original: gal te mngon sum las shes pa dang don dag gi rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum las shes pa dang don dag gi rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur mod /
translated: If one says: Although there is no distinction of cognition and object from direct perception,ğŸ”½there is a distinction by way of what is to be abandoned and what is to be left aside.

original: spang bya dang dor bya nyid kyis tha dad pa ni de las 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: spang bya dang dor bya nyid kyis tha dad pa ni de las 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
translated: In response to this doubt, it is explained:

original: blang dang dor bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blang dang dor bya zhes bya'o //
translated: What is to be taken up and what is to be left aside.

original: blang bya dang dor bya'i khyad par yang mngon sum las grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blang bya dang dor bya'i khyad par yang mngon sum las grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The distinction of what is to be taken up and what is to be left aside is also not established by direct perception. This is the meaning.

original: gal te blang bya dang dor bya ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /ğŸ”½de ci ltar mngon sum gyis mi rtogs snyam du dogs la bsu nas /
analyzed: gal te blang bya dang dor bya ni mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam / de ci ltar mngon sum gyis mi rtogs snyam du dogs la bsu nas /
translated: But isnâ€™t the nature of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected known by direct perception?ğŸ”½How is it that one does not understand that?

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, â€œThis is not the case.â€

original: sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu la brten pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu la brten pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the cause of suffering is based on the result.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis gang la rtogs te mi rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis gang la rtogs te mi rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: How could one understand that by direct perception that merely apprehends its own nature? One could not understand it.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is said that one does not understand what is to be adopted, which is the cause of happiness, that is different from that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de las gzhan bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa blang bya yang mi rtogs so zhes brjod pa ni min no zhes bya ba ste spang bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de las gzhan bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa blang bya yang mi rtogs so zhes brjod pa ni min no zhes bya ba ste spang bya'o //
translated: It is not the case that one does not understand what is to be rejected.

original: mngon sum tsam gyis gal 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum tsam gyis gal 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be the case that one understands it by direct perception alone?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: It could not be the case.

original: ci ltar 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin la mngon sum mi 'jug pa de ltar rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rtog par mdzad pa ni blang bya nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½blang bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ci ltar 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa'i rang bzhin la mngon sum mi 'jug pa de ltar rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rtog par mdzad pa ni blang bya nyid ni zhes bya ba'o // blang bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: In order to demonstrate that in the same way that the nature of the ultimate result is not engaged by direct perception, he composes the following verse: â€œThat which is to be accepted is that which is established as the means of achieving happiness, or as the negation of that which is to be rejected, which is the means of achieving suffering.â€ğŸ”½There are two types of conceptualization: that which is to be accepted is established as the means of achieving happiness, or that which is to be rejected is established as the means of achieving suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa dor bar bya ba nyid bkag pa las yin zhes rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis so //ğŸ”½dor bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa dor bar bya ba nyid bkag pa las yin zhes rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gnyis so // dor bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yang /
translated: That which is to be rejected is established as the negation of that which is to be accepted.

original: blang bya nyid du rnam bar gzhag pa las zlog pas yin te /ğŸ”½sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: blang bya nyid du rnam bar gzhag pa las zlog pas yin te / sdug bsngal gyi sgrub par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: That which is to be rejected is established as the negation of that which is to be accepted.ğŸ”½That which is to be rejected is established as the means of achieving suffering, or as the negation of that which is to be accepted, which is the means of achieving happiness.

original: bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa bkag pa las so zhes smras pa ni dor bya nyid ni zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag pa ni zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa bkag pa las so zhes smras pa ni dor bya nyid ni zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag pa ni zhes 'brel to //
translated: The statement â€œThat which is to be rejected is that which is established as the means of achieving suffering, or as the negation of that which is to be accepted, which is the means of achieving happinessâ€ is connected to the statement â€œThat which is to be rejected is that which is established as the means of achieving suffering, or as the negation of that which is to be accepted, which is the means of achieving happiness.â€

original: bzlog pa las zhes bya ba ni blang bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las bzlog pa las so //
analyzed: bzlog pa las zhes bya ba ni blang bya nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las bzlog pa las so //
translated: The opposite of that which is to be adopted is the opposite of that which is posited as to be adopted.

original: de la re zhig bde ba mngon sum nyid ma yin par ni dngos po la bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig bde ba mngon sum nyid ma yin par ni dngos po la bde ba'i sgrub par byed pa nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: First, it is said that the pleasant is not directly perceived, and the proof of the pleasant is not to be understood by direct perception of the thing.

original: don byed don du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don byed don du zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows.

original: don sreg pa la sogs pa dogs pa'o //
analyzed: don sreg pa la sogs pa dogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the object, such as burning.

original: bya ba ste byed pa po nyid ni na'o //
analyzed: bya ba ste byed pa po nyid ni na'o //
translated: The action is the agent.

original: blang bya ni de nyid yin @201b na de ni nye ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis mi mthong ngo mngon sum de las 'jug par byed 'dod pa rnams so //
analyzed: blang bya ni de nyid yin @201b na de ni nye ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis mi mthong ngo mngon sum de las 'jug par byed 'dod pa rnams so //
translated: That which is to be adopted is just that, and it is not seen by direct perception that apprehends the proximate nature. Those who desire to engage in that direct perception

original: ma mthong ba des na blang bya'i dngos po nyid rig ma yin zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: ma mthong ba des na blang bya'i dngos po nyid rig ma yin zhes 'brel to //
translated: do not know the nature of that which is to be adopted because they do not see it.

original: ci ltar mngon sum gyis ma mthong snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum gyis ma mthong snyam na /
translated: How is it that it is not seen by direct perception?

original: mngon sum 'byung 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum 'byung 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it arises from direct perception.

original: 'dis ni blang bya nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni blang bya nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsal ba yin no //
translated: This clarifies the position that it is because it is what is to be adopted.

original: dor bya nyid ni bkag pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: dor bya nyid ni bkag pa las zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'gog pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the position that it is because of the negation of what is to be rejected is:

original: spang bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spang bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œWhat is to be rejected is not negated.â€

original: spang bya nyid bkag pa ga la yod de ma yin pa nyid do /
analyzed: spang bya nyid bkag pa ga la yod de ma yin pa nyid do /
translated: How could there be a negation of what is to be rejected? It is not so.

original: spang bya dbang po las 'das phyir te /
analyzed: spang bya dbang po las 'das phyir te /
translated: Because what is to be rejected is beyond the senses.

original: sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the establishment of suffering is not manifest.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dor bya mngon sum ma yin pa des na blang bya 'di la spang bya'i dngos po med do zhes rtogs pa 'di ni mngon sum las ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dor bya mngon sum ma yin pa des na blang bya 'di la spang bya'i dngos po med do zhes rtogs pa 'di ni mngon sum las ma yin te /
translated: Since what is to be rejected is not manifest in that way, the understanding that â€œthis what is to be adopted does not have the nature of what is to be rejectedâ€ is not from a sense perception.

analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not in the wake of the activity of the senses, this is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du dor bya bzlog pa las nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang med do zhes rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dor bya bzlog pa las nyid rnam par gzhag pa yang med do zhes rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the understanding that â€œthe establishment of what is to be rejected is not reversedâ€ should be understood.

original: bshad zin ma thag pa'i tshul du rang gi dus na yod pa tsam 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid las na /
analyzed: bshad zin ma thag pa'i tshul du rang gi dus na yod pa tsam 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid las na /

analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba'i mngon sum gnyi gas kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni blang dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ means that the object of engagement of the two direct perceptions, the object of engagement of the proof, and the object of engagement of the probandum are not apprehended.

analyzed: rigs pa ni rang gi dus na yod pa tsam 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: bzlog nas 'jug pa ni bskyar nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog nas 'jug pa ni bskyar nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: â€œ Reverse engagementâ€ means repeated engagement.

analyzed: shin tu goms pa las mngon sum gyi blang bya la sogs pa thams cad 'dzin no snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //

original: ma rtogs pa la zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: â€œ In regard to what is not understoodâ€ is the response.

analyzed: gang gi phyir blang bya la sogs pa ma rtogs pa la goms pa med pa des na phan tshun bsten pa zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

analyzed: gal te dor bya'am blang bya mngon sum gyi yul ma yin na /
translated: If the object to be rejected or accepted is not the object of direct perception,

original: de la brten nas so //
analyzed: de la brten nas so //
translated: It is based on that.ğŸ”½If you think that direct perception which does not know both is not the apprehender of the relation,

analyzed: mngon sum gnyis las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'brel pa grub pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na ste /
translated: The relation of the conceptual cognition that arises from the two direct perceptions is established by direct perception alone.ğŸ”½This is because those who use conventions are attached to it in that way.

original: tha snyad pa rnams de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni don zhes bya ba ste gnyis kyi 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni don zhes bya ba ste gnyis kyi 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: The term â€œobjectâ€ refers to the relation between the two.

original: tha snyad ni rnam par rtog pa ste des grub pa yin pas /
analyzed: tha snyad ni rnam par rtog pa ste des grub pa yin pas /
translated: â€œ Conventionâ€ is conceptual cognition, and it is established by that.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba mchog tu gyur pa ni yongs su tshol bar mi byed de med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad pa rnams de tsam gyis yongs su tshim pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba mchog tu gyur pa ni yongs su tshol bar mi byed de med pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad pa rnams de tsam gyis yongs su tshim pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, â€œotherâ€ is the supreme, but it is not sought, because it does not exist and because those who use conventions are satisfied with just that.

original: gal te dor bya la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyi mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dor bya la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyi mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: If one says, â€œThe object to be abandoned and so on are not seen by direct perception,

original: des ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the domain of mere intrinsic nature.â€

original: 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa lkog tu gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrub par byed pa gzhan med pa lkog tu gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: However, it is not hidden that there is no other proof.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin la bsams na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin la bsams na /
translated: If one considers that it is not a different nature,

original: gang dag mthong ba'i don spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol spangs pa ma yin nam snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½'di yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di nyid kyang spong par byed ba la rag ste gyis shig / gang gi phyir 'di tsam gyis te /
analyzed: gang dag mthong ba'i don spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol spangs pa ma yin nam snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o // 'di yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di nyid kyang spong par byed ba la rag ste gyis shig / gang gi phyir 'di tsam gyis te /
translated: The phrase having abandoned the object of seeing and so on, does not this abandon the next world?ğŸ”½ The phrase this also means that one should abandon this very world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol bzlog ba tsam kho nas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol bzlog ba tsam kho nas so //
translated: Because of this much alone, that is, by merely refuting the next world, this also will be abandoned.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba rang rig pa'i mngon sum @202b rnam par gnas pa ma yin gyis /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba rang rig pa'i mngon sum @202b rnam par gnas pa ma yin gyis /
translated: This is not the case, because this is not established as a direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: 'on kyang gnyi ga yang dgag par bya ba yin no //ğŸ”½'jig rten kyang phan pa 'ga' zhig gnyi ga yang med do zhes brngod pa na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyi ga yang dgag par bya ba yin no // 'jig rten kyang phan pa 'ga' zhig gnyi ga yang med do zhes brngod pa na /
translated: However, both are to be refuted.ğŸ”½ When one is questioned, Is there any benefit in the world?

original: 'jig rten 'di yang yod min ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di yang yod min ni //
translated: One replies, This world does not exist,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and so on.

original: des nas zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: des nas zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The phrase then means in response.

original: thar pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is accepted that there is liberation.

original: gal te 'jig rten gnyi ga la bsnyon 'debs pa ni shin tu yang chad par lta ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gnyi ga la bsnyon 'debs pa ni shin tu yang chad par lta ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you deny both worlds, then wouldnâ€™t that be a nihilistic view?

original: des na med pa pa yang med ces ci ltar brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na med pa pa yang med ces ci ltar brjod snyam na /
translated: So how can you say, â€œThere is no nihilismâ€?

original: de lta yin na zhes bya bas te /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya bas te /
translated: â€œIf that is soâ€ means:

original: 'jig rten 'di yang bkag pa na'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di yang bkag pa na'o //
translated: If this world is refuted,

original: blang bya dang dor bya thams cad spangs pa ste bya ba bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blang bya dang dor bya thams cad spangs pa ste bya ba bzlog pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir rang rig pa'i gnas skabs na sems ni grol ba nyid de thar pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, the mind is liberated in the state of self-awareness, it becomes liberation itself.

original: de skad smra ba na ni med pa par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad smra ba na ni med pa par mi 'gyur te /

original: skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo la skur pa btab pa med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: because you do not deny the primary purpose of human life.

original: de la skur na de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la skur na de skad brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If you deny that, then you are a nihilist, because you say that.

original: gal te 'di ni bden te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis ni 'jig rten pha rol sgrub par mi byed la /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni bden te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis ni 'jig rten pha rol sgrub par mi byed la /

analyzed: 'jig rten 'di yang sgrub pa ma yin na'o //

original: sa la sogs pa de kho na nyid bzhir brjod pa ni dper bstan pa'i don te /

analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par dpyad na shin tu grags pa'i sa la sogs pa yang de kho na ma yin na /

analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa lta ci smos /

analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni thar pa skyes bu'i don du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Liberation is not the purpose of a person merely by this much,ğŸ”½because, like self-awareness, the conceptions of the subject of this world are also realities.
