analyzed: rmongs pa gzhan dag ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa gzhan te /
translated: â€œOther deluded peopleâ€ are others who conceive of the objects of other worlds, etc.

original: rab tu ma grub pa nyid kyis 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu ma grub pa nyid kyis 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are not accepted because they are not well established. This is the meaning.

original: rmongs pa 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: rmongs pa 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lan no //
translated: â€œThis delusion itselfâ€ is the response.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i yul can ga las zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i yul can ga las zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: â€œFrom what?â€ means â€œfrom no place at all.â€

original: gal te rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi thar pa gnod byed du mi 'gyur na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi thar pa gnod byed du mi 'gyur na'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if the existence of liberation were not undermined by reflexive awareness, then it would exist.

original: de'i phyir nges par gang nyid kyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par gang nyid kyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the mind is dependent on formations.

original: sems ni de med mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: sems ni de med mi 'byung ba //
translated: The mind does not occur without them.

original: de phyir sems la brten pa @203a * //ğŸ”½yin ; / zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de phyir sems la brten pa @203a * // yin ; / zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: Therefore, the mind is dependent on formations.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid dang / rang gi rigs mthun pa tsam las byung bar grub pa de'i tshe 'jig rten pha rol grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid dang / rang gi rigs mthun pa tsam las byung bar grub pa de'i tshe 'jig rten pha rol grub pa kho na ste /
translated: In this way, when it is established that conceptual thought has no beginning or end and arises from its own homogeneous type alone, then it is established that there is a world beyond.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid la de skad brjod pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid la de skad brjod pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The opponent might say, â€œWe say this because you say that it has no beginning or end.â€

original: gal te thog mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thog mtha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: We reply, â€œWhat is the point of saying â€˜beginning and endâ€™?

original: mang du smra ba gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: mang du smra ba gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of saying a lot of other things?

original: don med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is meaningless.â€

original: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pha rol grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pha rol grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the fault in the position that there is a cause,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: he anticipates the objection that there is no cause:ğŸ”½â€œBut if it is not produced by that,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is causeless.â€

original: rnam par rtog pa ni snga ma snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rjes su byed pa yin yang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni snga ma snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rjes su byed pa yin yang /

original: rnam par rtog pa des bskyed par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa des bskyed par bya ba ma yin na /

original: 'byung ba'i bskyed par bya ba ltar 'gyur re yang skan te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bskyed par bya ba ltar 'gyur re yang skan te /

original: de khyad par med kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khyad par med kyang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des na 'di rgyu med pa can yin na 'bras bu thams cad rgyu med pa can du 'gyur te /

original: 'di la rgyu med pas zhes bshad pas so //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu med pas zhes bshad pas so //
translated: because it is explained that this has no cause.

original: yang na rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //

original: rgyu med pa ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni rgyu ma yin te /

original: rang gi don la ka no'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir na rgyu med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don la ka no'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir na rgyu med pa yin no //

original: de ltar lan 'debs pa ni thams cad rgyu med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar lan 'debs pa ni thams cad rgyu med ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the reply: â€œEverything is causeless.â€

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyu med pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyu med pa yin na'o //
translated: If that is so,

original: med pa pa khyod kyis smras pa'i don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa pa khyod kyis smras pa'i don med par 'gyur te /
translated: then, O Nihilist, the meaning of your statement is non-existent,

analyzed: khyod kyis smras kyang gzhan rtogs bya'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because even though you speak, the cause of othersâ€™ understanding is non-existent.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gal te 'gar yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gal te 'gar yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: â€œIf anywhere at all,

original: ci don nyid de smras pa ni dgos pa dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci don nyid de smras pa ni dgos pa dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: yang na khyod kyi don du gnyer ba gang du yin te khyod kyis smras pa la dgos pa ci yod snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na khyod kyi don du gnyer ba gang du yin te khyod kyis smras pa la dgos pa ci yod snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Or else, what is the purpose of your statement? What is the need for what you say?

original: 'on te 'di la zhes bya ba ni brjod pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di la zhes bya ba ni brjod pa 'di la'o //
translated: Or else, if this is so,

original: don ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: then the meaning is the purpose.

analyzed: 'dir de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni lan no 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
translated: Here, â€œthatâ€ refers to the reply. â€œHereâ€ refers to the effect.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: â€œButâ€ refers to the other.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is â€œif.â€

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brgal zhing brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brgal zhing brtag pa'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the otherâ€™s objection.

original: gal te brgal zhing brtag pa la bsgrub par bya ba ci yang med mod kyi 'on kyang @203b de ni ma rig pa las byung ba yin no snyam na ni gal te 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½de lta na yang don med par smra btsam yin pa'i de bzhin kho nar nyes par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te brgal zhing brtag pa la bsgrub par bya ba ci yang med mod kyi 'on kyang @203b de ni ma rig pa las byung ba yin no snyam na ni gal te 'di ni zhes bya ba'o // de lta na yang don med par smra btsam yin pa'i de bzhin kho nar nyes par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that although there is nothing to prove in the objection, nevertheless, it arises from ignorance, then â€œif this is so.â€

original: su yis lan zhes smras te /
analyzed: su yis lan zhes smras te /
translated: If you think that even so, it is just meaningless talk, and the same fault arises, then â€œby whom is the reply given?â€

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ma rig pa nyid kyis nyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir ma rig pa nyid kyis nyes pa yin gyi /
translated: Since there is no purpose, the fault is due to ignorance itself.

analyzed: nged kyis go ci lan zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: â€œWhat is the reply?â€ is the thought of the other.

analyzed: lan du gal te bstan par bya ba'i ma rig pa chad pa ma yin na de'i tshe don med nyid de /

analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba de dogs pa bsu nas de gcod par byed pa'i tshig ni rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ltar rgyu med par smra zhes lan ldon ba ni / 'on te mi rig chad na yang //
translated: If you say, â€œThe word â€˜ifâ€™ is a word that cuts off a doubt that is raised, so how can it be said that it is without a cause?â€

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is:ğŸ”½Even if ignorance does not exist,

original: brgal zhing brtag pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin na /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can yin na /
translated: If the critique and examination have ignorance as their cause,

original: ma rig rnam rtog las gzhan min //
analyzed: ma rig rnam rtog las gzhan min //

original: zhes smos so //

original: de ltar thal bar 'gyur ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas mjug sdud pa ni /

original: bag chags kyang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bag chags kyang yin pa ste /

translated: The power of that is its dependence.

original: bdag tu 'dzin @204a * //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin @204a * //
translated: The state of that is itself.ğŸ”½The root text states, â€œBecause they are the basis for attachment and so on that arise from the habit of grasping at â€˜Iâ€™ and â€˜mine.â€™â€ğŸ”½They are the basis for attachment and so on.

analyzed: pa dang chags ba la sogs pa goms pa las byung ba 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi rten phyir te / rten yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: snga ma bzhin du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, it follows that the same error applies as before.ğŸ”½The power of that is its dependence.

original: de'i dbang ni de la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang ni de la rag las pa'o //
translated: The state of that is itself.ğŸ”½The root text states, â€œBecause they are the basis for attachment and so on that arise from the habit of grasping at â€˜Iâ€™ and â€˜mine.â€™â€ğŸ”½They are the basis for attachment and so on.ğŸ”½They are the basis for attachment and so on that arise from the habit of grasping at â€œIâ€ and â€œmine.â€ğŸ”½The meaning is that they are contaminated.ğŸ”½The cause of attachment and so on is grasping at â€œIâ€ and â€œmine,â€ not merely the cause.ğŸ”½For, it follows that the same error applies as before.ğŸ”½The power of that is its dependence.

original: de'i dngos po ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of that is itself.ğŸ”½The root text states, â€œBecause they are the basis for attachment and so on that arise from the habit of grasping at â€˜Iâ€™ and â€˜mine.â€™â€ğŸ”½They are the basis for attachment and so on.ğŸ”½They are the basis for attachment and so on that arise from the habit of grasping at â€œIâ€ and â€œmine.â€ğŸ”½The meaning is that they are contaminated.

original: rgyu dbang phyir na sdug bsngal yang //ğŸ”½zhes yang gi sgra rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyir na sdug bsngal yang //ğŸ”½zhes yang gi sgra rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of attachment and so on is grasping

original: bshad pa las ni goms pa las byung ba nyid bsdu ba'i don du yang gi sgra yin no zhes so //
analyzed: bshad pa las ni goms pa las byung ba nyid bsdu ba'i don du yang gi sgra yin no zhes so //
translated: The commentary states that the word â€œalsoâ€ is for the purpose of including that which arises from habituation.

original: ji ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'dod pa la rag las pas goms pa las byung ba dag ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i goms par ma byas pa nyid mchog yin la /

translated: Just as the cause of suffering is that which arises from habituation, such as the apprehension of a self, which is dependent on desire, the non-habituation to that is supreme.

analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyir na goms pa nyid mchog yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The opposite of that is supreme because it is incompatible with that.

original: gal te nga zhes bdag tu 'dzin pa rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nga zhes bdag tu 'dzin pa rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: If the apprehension of a self as â€œIâ€ is not the cause,

original: 'di ni goms pa las byung ba ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni goms pa las byung ba ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then it is not the case that it does not arise from habituation.

original: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has as its object something that is different from the body and the sense faculties.

original: sems pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni dbang po byed pa med pa can lus dmigs par ma gyur pa yin yang /

translated: In the state of intention, even though the body is not observed, the sense faculties are not active.

original: da'i zhes bdag tu 'dzin par nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: da'i zhes bdag tu 'dzin par nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: Still, the experience of the apprehension of a self as â€œIâ€ exists.

original: de skad du yang lus ma dmigs kyang bdag la de 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bdag min zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang lus ma dmigs kyang bdag la de 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bdag min zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, although the body is not perceived, it is as if it were the self.

original: bdag ni dmigs pa yang ma yin no //ğŸ”½de zhig rang rig pa ni yul dang dus la sogs pa ma bcad par yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni dmigs pa yang ma yin no // de zhig rang rig pa ni yul dang dus la sogs pa ma bcad par yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The self is not perceived.ğŸ”½The self is not the object of reflexive awareness, because it is not limited to a particular time and place.

original: nye ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a proximate object,

original: lhag par zhen pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it a special object of attachment.

original: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa na mthong ba'i lus la sogs pa phyi rol las tha dad pa la yul dang dus rnam par chad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa na mthong ba'i lus la sogs pa phyi rol las tha dad pa la yul dang dus rnam par chad par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: When one follows what is seen, one grasps the body, etc., as different from external things, and as limited to a particular time and place.

original: des na lus las tha dad pa'i dngos po rnam par mchad pa'i yod pa can ci ltar 'grub bden te /
analyzed: des na lus las tha dad pa'i dngos po rnam par mchad pa'i yod pa can ci ltar 'grub bden te /
translated: Thus, how can the self be established as having a nature that is limited to a particular time and place, and as different from the body?

original: bdag mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: The self is not directly perceived,

original: nye bar gnas pa tsam yin pas skad cig ma nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa tsam yin pas skad cig ma nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it is momentary, since it would be merely proximate.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: rnges su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnges su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be inferred later.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa dang @204b sdang ba dang 'bad rtsol dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi shes pa 'bras bur gyur pa rnams ni rten du gyur ba'i rgyu bdag ces bya ba rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa dang @204b sdang ba dang 'bad rtsol dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi shes pa 'bras bur gyur pa rnams ni rten du gyur ba'i rgyu bdag ces bya ba rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the consciousnesses of desire, hatred, effort, pleasure, and pain, which are the effects, are what cause one to understand the self, which is the basis that is the cause.

original: nyams su myong ba dang dran pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa dus tha dad pa can rnams ni de'i dus na yod pa'i dngos po med par 'byung ba ma yin te /

translated: Therefore, if the characteristic of arising is not pervaded,

original: yod pa yin yang khyab par bya ba nus srid par ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya @206a * //
analyzed: yod pa yin yang khyab par bya ba nus srid par ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya @206a * //

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i rgyu rtag pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i rgyu rtag pa rnams la'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the nonarising of the effect, which is the cause of the permanent.

original: de ltar 'dir ni 'bras bu skye ba med pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir ni 'bras bu skye ba med pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: In this way, here, the nonarising of the effect is not seen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshungs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: â€œSamenessâ€ is mentioned.

original: rung ba'i khyad par ni bag chags kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i khyad par ni bag chags kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in suitability is the difference in the latent impressions.

original: gang gis de med pas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa med pas 'bras bu med par ro //
analyzed: gang gis de med pas zhes bya ba ni rtag pa med pas 'bras bu med par ro //
translated: â€œSince that does not existâ€ means that since the permanent does not exist, the effect does not exist.

original: des na khyad par byed ba de tsam las mi 'byung ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par byed ba de tsam las mi 'byung ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no absence of the production of just that much which makes the difference.

original: khyab par byed pa med kyang khyab par bya ba yod par srid na ni rgyu rnams kyi tshad ma nges par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med kyang khyab par bya ba yod par srid na ni rgyu rnams kyi tshad ma nges par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the pervaded exists even when the pervader does not exist, then the determination of the measure of the causes would be possible. This is what is said in â€œmerely by the concomitance.â€

original: nam mkha' la sreg pa de dag ni rgyu rnams zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sreg pa de dag ni rgyu rnams zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: â€œThose in spaceâ€ are the causes, which are the sense faculties.

original: 'on te nam mkha' la sogs pa khyab ba ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha' la sogs pa khyab ba ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Or, if one doubts that space, etc., are not pervasive,

original: de dag kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: then â€œthoseâ€ is stated.

original: mi mtshungs bar dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: mi mtshungs bar dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Suspending the doubt that they are not similar,

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ste nam mkha' la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba ste nam mkha' la sogs pa dag go //
translated: â€œthoseâ€ refers to space, etc.

original: khyab pa dang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: khyab pa dang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: â€œPervasionâ€ is the reply.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: â€œThat itselfâ€ means that it is not the one who blesses.

original: yul khyab pa nyid med ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: yul khyab pa nyid med ba'i phyir na /
translated: Because the object is not pervasive,

original: de la ni med pas med pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ni med pas med pa yin te /
translated: it is not there, so it does not exist.

original: des na gzhan gyi rgyu can gyi khyab pa byar med pa yod bas na /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi rgyu can gyi khyab pa byar med pa yod bas na /
translated: Therefore, since the pervasive cause of the other does not exist,ğŸ”½it is only possible that it has the capacity.

original: de'i nus pa srid pa kho na'o snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i nus pa srid pa kho na'o snyam du dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni /
translated: The response to the doubt that this is so is stated:

original: rtag pa khyab byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa khyab byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe permanent is the pervader.â€

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
translated: â€œEverywhereâ€ means in the effect.

original: 'on te ma khyab pas rgyang ring po na gnas pa rnams ci ltar rgyu yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te ma khyab pas rgyang ring po na gnas pa rnams ci ltar rgyu yin snyam na /
translated: But if it is not pervasive, how can those that are distant be the cause?

original: nye ba nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nye ba nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is â€œbecause of proximity.â€

original: ci'i phyir de ltar rgyu ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar rgyu ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why is it not a cause in that way?

original: ring ba yin yang rgyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ring ba yin yang rgyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is â€œeven though it is distant, it is the cause.â€

original: gang gis ma khyab pa'i rtag pa de ltar 'gyur ba rnam ba de lta bu'i rgyur mthong ba gang yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas sgra sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis ma khyab pa'i rtag pa de ltar 'gyur ba rnam ba de lta bu'i rgyur mthong ba gang yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas sgra sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to the doubt that the permanent, which is not pervasive, is seen as the cause in that way is stated: â€œsound, etc.â€

original: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid thams cad du rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid thams cad du rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, permanence is the cause of everything,

original: rtag pa nyid kyis skyed byed du rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis skyed byed du rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is the producer by virtue of being the same nature as the effect.

original: des na skad cig ma yang ci'i phyir thams cad kyi skyed byed ma yin zhes bya ba'i thal ba med do //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma yang ci'i phyir thams cad kyi skyed byed ma yin zhes bya ba'i thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the consequence that â€œmomentariness is also the producer of everythingâ€ does not exist.

original: skabs nye bar sdud ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of this section is â€œTherefore . . . â€

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal de rtag pa ma yin te res 'ga' ba yin pa des na grub pa la bag chags la sogs pa rgyur byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal de rtag pa ma yin te res 'ga' ba yin pa des na grub pa la bag chags la sogs pa rgyur byed pa yin te /
translated: Since that suffering is not permanent but is sometimes experienced, it is the cause of latent impressions and so on.

original: rjes su @206b 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su @206b 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are concomitant with forward and reverse entailment.ğŸ”½How could impermanence be a cause, like permanence?

original: rtag pa ltar mi rtag pa yang ci ltar rgyu yin zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa ltar mi rtag pa yang ci ltar rgyu yin zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is untenable.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½rgyu dang bcas pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba'o // rgyu dang bcas pa nyid ma yin na /
translated: Since it is sometimes experienced,

original: res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhes brjod ba ni /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad do zhes brjod ba ni /

original: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and because it is not dependent on another.

original: 'di rang grub bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: 'di rang grub bar bya ba'i don du /

analyzed: med pa gzhan la ltos pa na phyis kyang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: if the non-existent were dependent on another, it would be just as it was before.

original: de bzhin du yod pa yang rang bzhin snga ma kho nar yod pa'i phyir dang rang gi ngo bo mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa yang rang bzhin snga ma kho nar yod pa'i phyir dang rang gi ngo bo mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /

original: ltos pa med pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni gzhan la mi ltos phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni gzhan la mi ltos phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement because it is not dependent on another is the same as because it does not depend on another.ğŸ”½It is said that this very intention is the teaching of the truth of origination.

original: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis na kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis na kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement the truth of origination is also is the same as the truth of origination is also.

original: sdug bsngal la rgyu med do zhes bya ba dgag pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni de la rgyu ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rgyu med do zhes bya ba dgag pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni de la rgyu ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to refute the statement that suffering has no cause, the statement the cause itself is the aspect. The statement that is the cause is the same as that is the cause.

original: rgyu gcig nyid ni gtso bo la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu gcig nyid ni gtso bo la sogs pa ste /
translated: The single cause is the primary principle and so on.

original: de yongs su spangs pas so //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs pas so //
translated: That is completely abandoned.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa ltar sred pa la nus pa med pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa ltar sred pa la nus pa med pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Craving is not the principal cause, like a potter, etc.

original: rab tu skye ba ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text says, â€œIt arises in dependence on the two.â€

original: gtso bo ni nye bar len pa nyid de de spangs pas so //
analyzed: gtso bo ni nye bar len pa nyid de de spangs pas so //
translated: The principal cause is appropriation, because it is abandoned when that is abandoned.

original: de la res 'ga' ba nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas ni rnam pa dang po sgrub ba gtsor byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni sdug bsngal gyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la res 'ga' ba nyid yin pas na zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pas ni rnam pa dang po sgrub ba gtsor byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni sdug bsngal gyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is sometimes present, the first line of the root text shows that it is not the principal cause.

original: de ltar ci ste bstan snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar ci ste bstan snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is taught in that way,

original: gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: the root text says, â€œThe other is not.â€

original: gzhan ni rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rgyu med pa'o //
translated: The other is causeless.

original: 'o na ci ltar res 'ga' ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar res 'ga' ba yin snyam na /
translated: If you think, â€œHow can it be sometimes present?â€

original: rgyu ldan la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu ldan la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: the root text says, â€œIt arises in dependence on the two.â€

original: 'o na rgyu med pa la ci zhig 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu med pa la ci zhig 'thad snyam na /
translated: If you think, â€œWhat is tenable about a cause that is not present?â€

original: rgyu med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: the root text says, â€œIt is not tenable that it is causeless.â€

original: yang na gzhan nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid du'o //
translated: Or, â€œit would not be otherâ€ means it would not be nonexistent.

original: co gang gis de skad brjod pa /
analyzed: co gang gis de skad brjod pa /
translated: By what means is it said to be so?

original: rgyu med pa 'ga' zhig de ltar mthong ba yod dam snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa 'ga' zhig de ltar mthong ba yod dam snyam na /
translated: If you think that some things without a cause are seen in that way,ğŸ”½then it is said that just as the consciousness of sound and so on of one with eye disease arises from a mere collection of causes, without a cause, and arises everywhere, so also suffering would arise without a cause.

original: dper na rab rib can gyi sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa yul gyi rgyu dang bral ba yig bye ba tsam las byung ba thams cad du 'byung ba sdug bsngal yang rgyu dang bral na de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ci lta zhes bya ba'o
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyi sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa yul gyi rgyu dang bral ba yig bye ba tsam las byung ba thams cad du 'byung ba sdug bsngal yang rgyu dang bral na de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ci lta zhes bya ba'o
translated: This is what is said by â€œhow?â€

original: // skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid du bcad do //
analyzed: // skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid du bcad do //
translated: This is the same as â€œhair and so on.â€

original: ci ltar rtag par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar rtag par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think, â€œHow could it be permanent?â€

original: yul med na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul med na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, â€œEven without an object.â€

original: yang na rgyu ma nges pa nyid @207a * //
analyzed: yang na rgyu ma nges pa nyid @207a * //
translated: Or, because the cause is not ascertained,

original: kyis rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kyis rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: there is no cause.

original: dper na chos kyi dbyings rtag tu yod pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /ğŸ”½rang rig pas ni rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: dper na chos kyi dbyings rtag tu yod pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni / rang rig pas ni rtogs bya ba //
translated: For example, just as the dharmadhÄtu always exists, so also suffering would exist.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said by â€œthat which is to be realized by reflexive awareness.â€

original: rang rig pas zhes bya bas ni tshad ma brjod do //
analyzed: rang rig pas zhes bya bas ni tshad ma brjod do //
translated: â€œBy reflexive awarenessâ€ expresses valid knowledge.

original: des na zhes pa ni stong pa la dmigs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na zhes pa ni stong pa la dmigs pa rnam par rtog pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the object of emptiness is non-conceptual.

original: rmi lam bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin no //
translated: Like a dream.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rmi lam na yang tshad ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rmi lam na yang tshad ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its own nature is valid even in a dream.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yang des rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yang des rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: The nature of the dharma-dhÄtu, which is characterized by the absence of subject and object, is also to be realized by that.

original: de yang ma nges pa nyid kyis rgyu med pa can dang byung pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar ba'i dus khyab pas na rtag tu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa nyid kyis rgyu med pa can dang byung pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar ba'i dus khyab pas na rtag tu yod pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, since it is uncertain, it is causeless, and since it pervades the past, future, and present, it exists eternally.

original: de nyid kyis res 'ga' ba ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis res 'ga' ba ma yin pa yin no //
translated: By that very fact, it is not occasional.

original: ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid rgyu nges pa med pas rgyu med pa can yin pa dang res 'ga' ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar mi rtag pa nyid rgyu nges pa med pas rgyu med pa can yin pa dang res 'ga' ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as impermanence is causeless because the cause is uncertain and not occasional.

original: med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ni mo gsham bu sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ni mo gsham bu sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It would become nonexistent, as in the case of the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: gal te res 'ga' ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal la rgyu yod mod de ni 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te res 'ga' ba nyid kyis sdug bsngal la rgyu yod mod de ni 'byung ba chen po'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi /
translated: If you say that suffering has a cause because it is sometimes absent, that cause is only the nature of the great elements.

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang las la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: It is not the nature of ignorance, craving, action, etc.,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the nature of God, etc.

original: 'byung ba chen po rgyu yin pa nyid na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rgyu yin pa nyid na /
translated: If the great elements are the cause,

original: 'jig rten pha rol grub pa bkag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol grub pa bkag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then the existence of another world is not refuted,

original: sred pa dang po'i sems 'du byed kyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyis sems gzhan go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir sems kyi rang bzhin gyi 'jig rten gzhan grub kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs rnams 'byung ba chen po
analyzed: sred pa dang po'i sems 'du byed kyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyis sems gzhan go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir sems kyi rang bzhin gyi 'jig rten gzhan grub kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gnas skabs rnams 'byung ba chen po
translated: because craving, which is the first mental state, is the cause of the subsequent mental states. Thus, although the existence of another world consisting of mind is established, the occurrence of the states consisting of pleasure, suffering, etc.,

original: tsam gyi rgyu tsam du grub pas na /
analyzed: tsam gyi rgyu tsam du grub pas na /
translated: is established as having the great elements alone as cause.

original: las la sogs pa'i sems pa'i rgyu can du mi 'grub po zhes rtsod par byed pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las la sogs pa'i sems pa'i rgyu can du mi 'grub po zhes rtsod par byed pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that they have action, etc., as their cause.

original: dper na chos can skyed par byed ba'i 'byung ba tsam las skyes pa'i phyir sems dang ldan pa'i rgyu med pa de bzhin du sring pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'jig rten gzhan na yod pa'i sems can gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khyad par du rtogsğŸ”½pa 'di dag kyang rgyu med 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na chos can skyed par byed ba'i 'byung ba tsam las skyes pa'i phyir sems dang ldan pa'i rgyu med pa de bzhin du sring pa'i phyir rang bzhin 'jig rten gzhan na yod pa'i sems can gyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khyad par du rtogs pa 'di dag kyang rgyu med 'gyur te /
translated: For example, just as the mind is causeless because it arises from the mere elements that give rise to phenomena, in the same way, the distinctions of the happiness and suffering of sentient beings in other worlds would be causeless.

original: sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes ni kha cig ste /
analyzed: sems pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes ni kha cig ste /
translated: Some say that this is the assertion of the nihilists.

original: rgyu med par @207b smra ba rab tu brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu med par @207b smra ba rab tu brjod do //
translated: The assertion of causelessness is fully expressed.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phang mdung zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phang mdung zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel to //
translated: The statement â€œthe nature of things is to act, etc.â€ is explained by â€œlike a spear thrown into the air.â€

original: de la khyad par dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mgar ba la sogs pa med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: de la khyad par dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mgar ba la sogs pa med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par 'grel to //
translated: The statement â€œDistinctions also, etc.â€ is explained by â€œeven without a blacksmith, etc.â€

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin ni 'byung ba chen po nyid las byung ba'i phyir sems pa dang ldan pas mi byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin ni 'byung ba chen po nyid las byung ba'i phyir sems pa dang ldan pas mi byed do //
translated: The nature of the great elements is not created by a conscious creator, because it arises from the great elements themselves.

original: 'on kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par 'ba' zhig byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin khyad par 'ba' zhig byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de ltar rnam pa dang po bsgrubs nas mjug sdud pa ni de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba'o //

original: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gcig nyid bkag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu gcig nyid bkag pa'o //
translated: The second is the refutation of a single cause.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang po dang bcas pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang po dang bcas pa yin yang ngo //
translated: â€œEven though it has a causeâ€ means even though it has the first alternative.

original: rgyu gcig nyid du mi 'dod de des na de dgag pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu gcig nyid du mi 'dod de des na de dgag pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: A single cause is not accepted, and so the second alternative is for the purpose of refuting that.

original: ji ltar rtag pa gcig pu rgyu yin pa bkag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa gcig pu rgyu yin pa bkag ce na /
translated: How is a permanent, single cause refuted?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIfâ€ means â€œif it were to exist.â€

original: gcig ces bya ba ni gal te snga ma dang phyi mar gcig pa'i rgyu rang bzhin rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni gal te snga ma dang phyi mar gcig pa'i rgyu rang bzhin rgyu yin na /
translated: â€œSingleâ€ means if the cause is a single nature that is the same in the beginning and end,

original: de'i tshe rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thams cad kyi tshe 'bras bu thams cad 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thams cad kyi tshe 'bras bu thams cad 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it would be permanent, meaning that at all times it would be the cause of all effects.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas rim gyis byed do snyam na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas rim gyis byed do snyam na /
translated: If you think that it acts gradually in dependence on its cooperating conditions,

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that it would not depend on them.

original: 'di nyid gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di nyid gang las she na /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: rtag pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: â€œbecause of permanence.â€

original: cig car ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cig car ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gtso bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression â€œnot all at onceâ€ is stated in the words â€œprimordial nature, etc.â€

original: 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan rim dang rim gyis ma yin pa @209b dang bral ba 'di yang /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan rim dang rim gyis ma yin pa @209b dang bral ba 'di yang /
translated: This reason for cessation, i.e., the absence of gradual and successive change,

original: de ga las she na zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis gsal bar byed pa ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ga las she na zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis gsal bar byed pa ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is clarified by the question â€œwhy?â€ and the answer â€œbecause of the absence of potentiality.â€

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: For this very reason, it is said that â€œÄªÅ›vara, etc. are not the cause of creation.â€

original: rnam pa gsum pa rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression â€œnot the cause of creation in the three waysâ€ is stated in the words â€œnot the cause of creation.â€

original: 'o na de su'i yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de su'i yin snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then whose is it?

original: rnam pa 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: â€œthis mode.â€

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rab tu skye ba srid pa nyid kyi yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rab tu skye ba srid pa nyid kyi yin pa'o //
translated: The expression â€œthat veryâ€ refers to the possibility of creation.

original: rtag pa rnams ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rtag pa rnams ni nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: The expression â€œbecause of the absence of potentialityâ€ is supplied.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa rnams nus pa med pa'i phyir rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir srid pa'i 'dod pa nyid skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa rnams nus pa med pa'i phyir rab tu skye ba nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir srid pa'i 'dod pa nyid skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Because permanent things are not productive, because they are not productive, the cause of suffering is the grasping of existence, which is the cause of grasping the desire for existence.

original: 'di ga las snyam na gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na gang gi phyir /
translated: From what is this known? Because

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi yul gyi khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa bdag gir byed pa ni yul gyi khyab bar 'dod pas byas par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi yul gyi khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa bdag gir byed pa ni yul gyi khyab bar 'dod pas byas par mthong ba yin no //
translated: it is seen that the grasping of the special object of the world is done by the desire for the special object.

original: las dang lus ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rgyu yin yang yul gyi khyad par du phyin pa ni srid pa nyid kyis bya ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni rgyu gzhan nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las dang lus ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rgyu yin yang yul gyi khyad par du phyin pa ni srid pa nyid kyis bya ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni rgyu gzhan nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Although karma, body, ignorance, etc. are causes, the attainment of the special object is done by existence itself. This is explained in the verse â€œIf another cause is needed.ğŸ”½â€ The following verse is stated to clarify this:

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni las sam zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ni sred pa pa med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni las sam zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs brjod pa ni sred pa pa med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If craving does not exist, grasping does not occur.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa des bya ba yin yang skye ba thob pa de ltar ci ste 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa des bya ba yin yang skye ba thob pa de ltar ci ste 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how can that which is the activity of appropriation be birth?

original: yongs su 'dzin pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That appropriation is also

original: gang gi phyir skye ba rjes su 'brel pa yongs su 'dzin pa las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba rjes su 'brel pa yongs su 'dzin pa las /
translated: because birth is not separate from the appropriation that is its antecedent.

original: gzhan ma yin pa des na skye ba rjes su 'brel pa 'di rab tu skye ba ni srid pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa des na skye ba rjes su 'brel pa 'di rab tu skye ba ni srid pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, this birth that is related to the antecedent is only existence.

original: phyin par byed pa'i bya ba can yin pa'i phyir na sred pa nyid rab tu skye ba yin mod /
analyzed: phyin par byed pa'i bya ba can yin pa'i phyir na sred pa nyid rab tu skye ba yin mod /
translated: Since it is the activity of one who has gone, craving is the one who is born.ğŸ”½But how can craving be the one who is born?

original: sred pa 'dod go ji ltar yin snyam na de ni de nyid yin no zhes brjod pas ni sred 'dod ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sred pa 'dod go ji ltar yin snyam na de ni de nyid yin no zhes brjod pas ni sred 'dod ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement â€œit is just thatâ€ in the verse means that craving is the one who is born.

original: gal te sred pa tsam ni kun 'byung ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te sred pa tsam ni kun 'byung ma yin te /
translated: If you think that mere craving is not the origin of suffering,

original: mdo las 'dod pa'i sred pa la sogs pa gsum kun 'byung du bstan pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: mdo las 'dod pa'i sred pa la sogs pa gsum kun 'byung du bstan pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: because the sutras teach three kinds of craving, craving for desire realm objects and so on, as the origin of suffering,

original: gal te yul gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yul gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the root text states, â€œCraving for the objects of the three realms.â€

original: sred pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Craving is the form of desire that seeks future existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang sred pa'i dgos pa can yin pa'i phyir yang 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang sred pa'i dgos pa can yin pa'i phyir yang 'byung ba can no //
translated: Therefore, it is the cause of birth, because it is the cause of craving.

original: dga' ba dang 'dod chags @210a * //
analyzed: dga' ba dang 'dod chags @210a * //
translated: Delight and attachment

original: de gnyis dang ldan pa'i 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis dang ldan pa'i 'dres pa ste /
translated: are mixed with that craving.

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun gyis 'chol mar skye ba'i phyir yin gyi mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun gyis 'chol mar skye ba'i phyir yin gyi mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: They are called mixed because they are born in a confused way through the continuity of birth and death, but not because they are associated.

original: 'dod chags gnyis mtshungs par ldan ba med ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½de la dga' ba ni da ltar ba'i don la dmigs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags gnyis mtshungs par ldan ba med ba'i phyir ro // de la dga' ba ni da ltar ba'i don la dmigs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi rtogs pa'o //
translated: For the two attachments are not associated.ğŸ”½Delight is a defiled conception that has as its object the present object.

original: 'dod chags nga ltar ba'i don la dmigs pa'i mngon par zhen pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags nga ltar ba'i don la dmigs pa'i mngon par zhen pa nyid do //
translated: Attachment is the adherence that has as its object the future object.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gang gi nga ltar gyi tshe'i dngos po la nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog ba dang mngon par zhen pa rab tu skye ba des na //
analyzed: gang gi nga ltar gyi tshe'i dngos po la nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog ba dang mngon par zhen pa rab tu skye ba des na //
translated: When there is a defiled conception and adherence to the entity of the present, then there is a defiled conception and adherence to the entity of the future.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'am /
translated: Or else,

original: de las khyad par 'phags pa'i ma 'ongs pa la yang 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de las khyad par 'phags pa'i ma 'ongs pa la yang 'dod pa yin no //
translated: it is the future that is superior to that.

original: gang dag nga ltar ba'i dngos po nyid la dga' ba dang 'dod chags las grol pa de dag ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po don du gnyer bar byed /
analyzed: gang dag nga ltar ba'i dngos po nyid la dga' ba dang 'dod chags las grol pa de dag ji ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po don du gnyer bar byed /
translated: How can those who are free from attachment and delight in the very thing that is the self, strive for a future thing?

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba can zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang longs spyod pa la sogs pa thams cad la don du gnyer pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba can zhes bya ba ni srid pa dang longs spyod pa la sogs pa thams cad la don du gnyer pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression â€œwho delight in this and thatâ€ is that they strive for all of existence, for the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: de la 'dod ba'i khams don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod ba'i khams don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa ni 'dod pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: Among them, the form of striving for the desire realm is the craving for desire.

original: 'dod par byas pas na 'dod pas de gzugs la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod par byas pas na 'dod pas de gzugs la sogs ba'o //
translated: Desire is that for which one longs, such as form, etc.

original: de la don med pa mang po dang ldan zhing snying po med pa rnams la snying por 'du shes pa rnams srid pa brgyud pa thog ma med ba nas goms pas bskyed pa bde bar sred pa skye ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la don med pa mang po dang ldan zhing snying po med pa rnams la snying por 'du shes pa rnams srid pa brgyud pa thog ma med ba nas goms pas bskyed pa bde bar sred pa skye ba ni 'dod pa'i sred pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The craving for pleasure is called craving for desire realm objects, because it is generated by the habit of transmigrating in cyclic existence since beginningless time, and because it is the perception of an essence in that which is essenceless and has much that is meaningless.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa don du gnyer ba ni srid pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa don du gnyer ba ni srid pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for existence is the desire for form and formless states.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: Craving for nonexistence is the desire to be free from suffering.

original: gang las zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni sdud ba'i don can ni 'brel ba'i phyir na de yang zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni sdud ba'i don can ni 'brel ba'i phyir na de yang zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word from in the verse means from which.

original: srid pa'i sred pa 'ba' zhig ni srid 'dod ma yin gyi 'on kyang de yang yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i sred pa 'ba' zhig ni srid 'dod ma yin gyi 'on kyang de yang yin no //
translated: Not only craving for existence is craving for existence, but also craving for nonexistence is craving for existence.

original: de zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dod pa gang las srog chags shes rab dang bral ba 'jug pa'i ji ltar 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: 'dod pa gang las srog chags shes rab dang bral ba 'jug pa'i ji ltar 'jug snyam na /
translated: From what desire do beings who lack wisdom enter?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa thob dang dor bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa thob dang dor bar 'dod pas so //
translated: Because one desires to obtain pleasure and to avoid pain.

original: 'dir ni nye bar mkho ba la sogs ba'i yul can gyi sred pa 'jug ba'i rgyur brjod pa yin no//
analyzed: 'dir ni nye bar mkho ba la sogs ba'i yul can gyi sred pa 'jug ba'i rgyur brjod pa yin no//
translated: Here, craving is the cause of the engagement of the craving that has as its object the attainment of pleasure and the avoidance of pain.

original: @210b bde ba dang sdug bsngal thob pa dang dor bar 'dod pa de dag nyid la mdo las rnam par phye nas 'dod pa'i srid pa dang 'jig pa'i sred pa'i sgras brjod do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: @210b bde ba dang sdug bsngal thob pa dang dor bar 'dod pa de dag nyid la mdo las rnam par phye nas 'dod pa'i srid pa dang 'jig pa'i sred pa'i sgras brjod do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The SÅ«tra explains that the desire to obtain pleasure and to avoid pain are called craving for desire and craving for existence, respectively.

original: 'dod pa dang 'jig pa'i 'dod pa de dag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //ğŸ”½de ji ltar na de 'dra srid 'dod yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang 'jig pa'i 'dod pa de dag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o // de ji ltar na de 'dra srid 'dod yin snyam na /
translated: They are the very same craving for desire and craving for existence.ğŸ”½How is that so?

original: gang 'di zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'di zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, â€œThat which is called craving for existence is the desire for the pleasure of the future.â€

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dag gzung ngo //
translated: The words â€œand so onâ€ include the desire for the pleasure of the present and the desire to be free from the pain of the present.

original: don 'di yin te srid ba'i sgras ni 'khor ba'i rnam grangs su yin la /
analyzed: don 'di yin te srid ba'i sgras ni 'khor ba'i rnam grangs su yin la /
translated: The meaning is as follows: The term â€œexistenceâ€ is a synonym for saá¹ƒsÄra.

original: 'khor ba dang gnas dang nye bar mkho ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang gnas dang nye bar mkho ba dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba'o //
translated: Samsara, abode, necessities, being endowed with pleasure, and being free from suffering.

original: de la 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Desire also arises in three ways.

original: srid pa'i 'dod pa de ni thams cad nyid yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod pa de ni thams cad nyid yin te /
translated: That desire for existence is all of them,

original: gcig kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: but not just one.

original: 'di nyid rnam par dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par dbye ba ni 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The analysis of just that is â€œdesire for desire,â€ and so on.

original: rnam par phye ba nyid nges bar ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba nyid nges bar ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the analysis is â€œwhatever.â€

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nye bar mkho ba rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nye bar mkho ba rtogs par byed do //
translated: The word â€œand so onâ€ makes known the necessities.

original: gang la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which does not have any contradiction is said to be â€œjust that.â€

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan pa ni srid 'dod ces bya bar ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan pa ni srid 'dod ces bya bar ro //
translated: The teaching of the truth of origination is â€œdesire for existence.â€

original: de'i phyir sred pa 'di gsum ka yang kun 'byung gi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa 'di gsum ka yang kun 'byung gi bden pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, all three of these desires are the truth of origination.

original: 'jug pa'i dbye ba lam rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i dbye ba lam rnam pa gsum du gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
translated: The point of the passage is to say that the classification of the path is established as threefold.

original: sred pa nyid skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas sgrub pa'i phyir bdag tu chags pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sred pa nyid skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas sgrub pa'i phyir bdag tu chags pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to prove that craving itself is the cause of birth by means of another aspect, he says, â€œdue to attachment to self.â€

original: kun la zhes bya ba ni gnas dang nye bar mkho ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: kun la zhes bya ba ni gnas dang nye bar mkho ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: â€œ In allâ€ means in regard to dwelling, necessities, etc.

original: bde ba ma yin pa la bde bar 'du shes 'jug pa'i rgyu ni bdag tu chags pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba ma yin pa la bde bar 'du shes 'jug pa'i rgyu ni bdag tu chags pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the occurrence of the notion of pleasure in regard to what is not pleasure is attachment to self, not anything else.

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu yin ba de phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu yin ba de phyir /
translated: Since it is the cause of occurrence,

original: srid pa nyid sred pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: srid pa nyid sred pa'i rten yin no //
translated: craving itself is the basis of existence.

original: gal te bdag med pa'i phyir bstan pa 'di ji ltar 'thad snyam na ngar 'dzin pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa'i phyir bstan pa 'di ji ltar 'thad snyam na ngar 'dzin pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks, â€œHow can this teaching be tenable because of the non-existence of self?â€ he says, â€œdue to the conception of self.â€

original: de la chags pa sred pa zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la chags pa sred pa zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin te /
translated: That which has the name â€œcravingâ€ and is associated with another name, â€œattachment to that,â€ is the cause,

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: that which is helpful.

original: ji ltar rgyu yin snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu yin snyam du dogs na /
translated: If one wonders how it is a cause,ğŸ”½the root text says,

original: kun las rab tu 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: kun las rab tu 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: â€œIt is the basis for engaging in all.â€

original: zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba'i rjes su brjod nas 'chad @211a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba'i rjes su brjod nas 'chad @211a * //
translated: The commentary explains this:

original: pa ni / gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa ni / gnas dang longs spyod la sogs pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œThe basis, enjoyments, and so on.â€

original: su zhig 'jug snyam na /

analyzed: de la yang brjod pa ni gal te las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response to this, the root text states, â€œIf karma does not exist. . . .â€

analyzed: las med pa'i sgo nas sred pa dang bral ba nyid yongs su 'dor ba la byed pa yin te /

analyzed: rgyu kun 'byung la gags te 'gal ba'i lam mo //

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba'o //

original: 'dis ni rgyu med pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu med pa brjod do //
translated: This indicates the absence of a cause.

translated: If one were to think that the nature of the aggregates of the transmigrator is the completeness of the cause, how could it be the obstruction?

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni snga ma 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni snga ma 'gog pa'o //
translated: The response to this is â€œNo!â€ The word â€œnoâ€ denies the previous statement.

original: ci'i phyir snyam na 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because of the assertion.
