analyzed: 'khor ba gang yin pa de thar pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The assertion is that what is transmigration is not liberation.

original: skad cig la ltos nas ni 'gal ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: skad cig la ltos nas ni 'gal ba nyid yin na /
translated: If it were in relation to momentariness, there would be a contradiction.

original: rgyun la ltos nas 'gal bar ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun la ltos nas 'gal bar ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement â€œbecause it is not establishedâ€ means that the contradiction is not established in terms of the continuum.

original: gang 'khor ba pa yin pa de nyid 'khor ba pa ma yin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba pa yin pa de nyid 'khor ba pa ma yin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the very one who is a transmigrator is not a transmigrator.

original: 'on kyang 'khor ba pa'i sems kyi rgyun las rgyu'i khyad par thob pas phyi ma'i char thar pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba pa'i sems kyi rgyun las rgyu'i khyad par thob pas phyi ma'i char thar pa skye ba yin no //
translated: However, liberation arises in the future from the continuum of the mind of a transmigrator, because it obtains a special cause.

original: des na 'di 'khor ba pa nyid du ma grub po //
analyzed: des na 'di 'khor ba pa nyid du ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that this is a transmigrator.

original: 'khor ba pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skad cig la ltos nas 'gal ba nyid gzhung btsugs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skad cig la ltos nas 'gal ba nyid gzhung btsugs pa yin la /
translated: The statement â€œbecause of being a transmigratorâ€ and so on establishes the contradiction in terms of momentariness.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyun la ltos na 'gal ba nyid ma grub po zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyun la ltos na 'gal ba nyid ma grub po zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The statement â€œhoweverâ€ and so on expresses the fact that the contradiction is not established in terms of the continuum.

original: ma grub phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don gzhan brjod pa ni don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: ma grub phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don gzhan brjod pa ni don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The statement â€œbecause it is not establishedâ€ itself expresses another meaning, namely, â€œultimately.â€

original: don dam par rnam par dpyad pas ni /
analyzed: don dam par rnam par dpyad pas ni /
translated: When analyzed ultimately,

original: 'khor ba pa nyid mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: 'khor ba pa nyid mi 'grub kyi /
translated: transmigration is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu ni sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sdug bsngal 'khor ba can phung po zhes bya ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is not contradictory to say that the aggregates, which are the suffering of cyclic existence, exist conventionally.

original: gal te bcings pa dang grol ba dag gcig cig pa ma yin na de'i tshe rtog pa dang ldan pa ji ltar rgyu sbyor ba la brtson zhes @213a * //
analyzed: gal te bcings pa dang grol ba dag gcig cig pa ma yin na de'i tshe rtog pa dang ldan pa ji ltar rgyu sbyor ba la brtson zhes @213a * //
translated: If bondage and liberation were not the same, then how could a rational person strive to apply the cause of liberation?

original: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word â€œifâ€ is used to express this doubt.

original: bstan bcos sbyor bas ngal zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos goms pa 'bad ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos sbyor bas ngal zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos goms pa 'bad ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The word â€œwearyâ€ in the line â€œweary of the application of treatisesâ€ refers to those who are diligent in the study of treatises.ğŸ”½In order to demonstrate that the assertion of selflessness does not undermine the many worldly goods, many examples are given.

original: bdag med bar smra ba la 'ga' zhig la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la zhugs pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i legs pa mang po rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du dper brjod pa mang du byas so //ğŸ”½bdag tu smra ba la yang /
analyzed: bdag med bar smra ba la 'ga' zhig la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la zhugs pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i legs pa mang po rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du dper brjod pa mang du byas so // bdag tu smra ba la yang /
translated: The assertion of self also does not undermine the many worldly goods.

original: bdag yod pa tsam gyis ni 'jug pa dang ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag yod pa tsam gyis ni 'jug pa dang ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the mere existence of the self that causes engagement and disengagement.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de'i shes pas so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de'i shes pas so //
translated: What then? It is the knowledge of the self.

original: de ni bdag med par smra ba la yang mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ni bdag med par smra ba la yang mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is the same for the proponents of selflessness.

original: ji srid du bdag la chags pa zhen pa'i snying po can gyi shes pa ma bcos par gyur pa de srid du bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: ji srid du bdag la chags pa zhen pa'i snying po can gyi shes pa ma bcos par gyur pa de srid du bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba /
translated: As long as the consciousness that is the essence of attachment to self is uncorrected, one is suffering,

original: 'khor ba nyid du sgro btags nas te /
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid du sgro btags nas te /
translated: and is bound to cyclic existence.ğŸ”½Having imagined,

original: rlom nas yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlom nas yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one is tormented.

original: sdug bsngal gyis gdung ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis gdung ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is endowed with the torment of suffering.

original: des na sdug bsngal de spang ba'i don du thams cad rjes su bsgrub pas dkrugs pas na rang bzhin du gnas ba nyid mi 'thob po //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal de spang ba'i don du thams cad rjes su bsgrub pas dkrugs pas na rang bzhin du gnas ba nyid mi 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon that suffering, one is disturbed by the pursuit of everything, and so one does not attain natural peace.

original: des na grol ba po'i bdag med kyang /
analyzed: des na grol ba po'i bdag med kyang /
translated: Therefore, although there is no self that is the experiencer,

original: bdag tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid log par sgro btags pa de nyid kyi gzhol ba'i phyir brtson te /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid log par sgro btags pa de nyid kyi gzhol ba'i phyir brtson te /
translated: one strives to eliminate the reification that is the characteristic of attachment to a self.ğŸ”½Because one strives to realize the teaching of the BhagavÄn,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa dang / de rjes su bsgrub pa la brtson par 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa dang / de rjes su bsgrub pa la brtson par 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: and to practice in accordance with it,

original: tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub pa 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di nyid brjod pa ni 'on te nged lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub pa 'bras bu med pa ma yin no // 'di nyid brjod pa ni 'on te nged lta bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the practice of pure conduct, etc. is not fruitless.ğŸ”½This is what is being said: â€œBut if we are like that . . . â€

original: de zhes bya ba ni nged lta bu'i'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nged lta bu'i'o //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to â€œwe are like that.â€

original: de dag ces bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni bcings pa dang thar pa'o //
translated: â€œThoseâ€ refers to bondage and liberation.

original: gal te bcings pa dang thar pa dag gzhi gcig pa nyid ma yin na //
analyzed: gal te bcings pa dang thar pa dag gzhi gcig pa nyid ma yin na //
translated: If bondage and liberation are not the same basis,

original: de kho na ltar tha snyad ci ste mi byed snyam na /
analyzed: de kho na ltar tha snyad ci ste mi byed snyam na /
translated: why not make the conventional designation in exactly that way?

original: dngos po don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po don dam par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIn realityâ€ means ultimately.

original: rtogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir na lhag bar zhen pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir na lhag bar zhen pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it depends on realization, it depends on strong adherence.

original: 'di nyid sgrub par byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid sgrub par byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the proof: â€œBecause . . . â€

original: lhag bar mos pa'i yul ni spang ba'i yul yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: lhag bar mos pa'i yul ni spang ba'i yul yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The object of strong adherence is the object of abandonment.

original: gal te de kho na mthong ba don byas zin pa'i phyir rang gi don du mi 'jug @213b pa yin du zin kyang gzhan gyi don la ni 'jug pa kho na yin pas na /
analyzed: gal te de kho na mthong ba don byas zin pa'i phyir rang gi don du mi 'jug @213b pa yin du zin kyang gzhan gyi don la ni 'jug pa kho na yin pas na /
translated: If, having completed the purpose of seeing reality, he does not engage in his own purpose, he does engage in the purpose of others.

original: de 'di'i ched du lam 'di bdag gis bstan par bya'o zhes rnam par rtog pas 'bad par ci ltar byed snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'di'i ched du lam 'di bdag gis bstan par bya'o zhes rnam par rtog pas 'bad par ci ltar byed snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, with the thought, â€œI will teach this path for his sake,â€ how could he exert himself with conceptual thought?ğŸ”½The response to the doubt is â€œBut if he were to teachâ€¦â€

original: kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod par 'gyur mod ces bya ba ni slob ma yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu tha snyad yod par 'gyur mod ces bya ba ni slob ma yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œConventionally, it would existâ€ means that the disciple is not fully developed.

original: don dam par ci ltar zhes bya ba ni don ston pa po yongs su rdzogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ci ltar zhes bya ba ni don ston pa po yongs su rdzogs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: â€œUltimately, how?â€ means that the teacher is fully developed.

original: de zhig slob ma ni bdag nyid bzhin du ston pa po yang gcig nyid yin par rig go zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de zhig slob ma ni bdag nyid bzhin du ston pa po yang gcig nyid yin par rig go zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The response is that â€œjust as the disciple is one, so the teacher is one, like himself.â€

original: ci ltar gcig nyid ces bya ba'o /
analyzed: ci ltar gcig nyid ces bya ba'o /
translated: â€œHow is he one?â€

original: ston pa po yang rtogs pa med kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa las 'jug pa na /
analyzed: ston pa po yang rtogs pa med kyang sngon gyi 'phen pa las 'jug pa na /
translated: Even though the teacher does not understand, he engages by the impetus of former practice.

original: don dam par gcig nyid dam tha snyad kyang mthong ba med ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni da ltar de nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par gcig nyid dam tha snyad kyang mthong ba med ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni da ltar de nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is not the case that ultimately there is no seeing of identity or even of convention.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bad pa yang rang rig pa tsam yin gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bad pa yang rang rig pa tsam yin gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is said that the effort of freedom from attachment is mere self-awareness, but not discursive thought.

original: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is not other than its own nature.

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed na ji ltar tha snyad du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed na ji ltar tha snyad du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: If one does not discursively think, how is there convention?

original: ji ltar sa bon la sogs pa rnam par rtog par mi byed kyang myu gu skyed par byed pa de bzhin du grub zin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog par mi byed kyang sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i tha snyad skyed par byed de zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon la sogs pa rnam par rtog par mi byed kyang myu gu skyed par byed pa de bzhin du grub zin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog par mi byed kyang sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i tha snyad skyed par byed de zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Just as a seed, etc. , does not discursively think, but produces a sprout, so also, because it is already established, it does not discursively think, but produces the convention of prior performance.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that the state of cause and effect.

original: ci'i phyir 'di mkhas pa'i tshul ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di mkhas pa'i tshul ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why is this not the way of the wise?

original: grub zin pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub zin pa la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa las gzhan pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And even in the case of something already existent, the fact of its being a cause and an effect is not apprehended by a means of valid knowledge other than conceptual thought. This is what is meant by â€œthus.â€

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po brtags nas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po brtags nas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: ci'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Why would there be no engagement and disengagement?

original: sngon dang phyi mar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi mar zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is what is meant by â€œprior and subsequent.â€

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po ni rtsod pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po ni rtsod pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fact of being a cause and an effect is not a matter of dispute.

original: skad cig gnyis par mi sdod pa la ni 'ga' zhig tu yang 'jug pa mi srid do zhes brjod pa ni skad cig tsam la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis par mi sdod pa la ni 'ga' zhig tu yang 'jug pa mi srid do zhes brjod pa ni skad cig tsam la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is impossible for something that does not remain in the second moment to engage in anything at all. This is what is meant by â€œin just a moment.â€

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa med pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa med pas so //
translated: Therefore, because there is no engagement,

original: nor pa ni thar pa'i don du 'bad do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nor pa ni thar pa'i don du 'bad do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: error is the conceptual thought that thinks, â€œI will strive for the goal of liberation.â€

original: skad cig tsam rig par byed pa'i mngon @214a * //
analyzed: skad cig tsam rig par byed pa'i mngon @214a * //
translated: The direct perception that is aware of just a moment

original: sum ni grub zin pa dang ma zin pa gnyis kyi brtse ba dang rnam par rtog pas 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni khas blangs nas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sum ni grub zin pa dang ma zin pa gnyis kyi brtse ba dang rnam par rtog pas 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni khas blangs nas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ is used to indicate that the Buddhaâ€™s compassion and his conceptualization engage the already attained and the not yet attained.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs brtse bas 'khor ba ci srid bzhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs brtse bas 'khor ba ci srid bzhugs pa yin la /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas remain in cyclic existence out of compassion for as long as it lasts.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni las kyis dus cung zad gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni las kyis dus cung zad gnas pa yin no //
translated: The passionless remain for a while by the power of karma.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams la yang sku tshe ring po mngon par grub par byed pa'i las ni mnga' ba kho na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams la yang sku tshe ring po mngon par grub par byed pa'i las ni mnga' ba kho na'o //
translated: The Blessed Ones have the karma to remain for a long time.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i cha nyid la rtsod pa ni dam pa'i don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i cha nyid la rtsod pa ni dam pa'i don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The argument about the very words of the verse is â€œin the ultimate sense.â€

original: 'di nyid la lan gdab pa'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa'i don sbyor bar byed pa ni spyod pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid la lan gdab pa'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa'i don sbyor bar byed pa ni spyod pa'i yul can gyi shes pa'am /
translated: The meaning of the verse is to be understood by way of the reply to that argument.

original: ma khong nas dbyung bas ma dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ma khong nas dbyung bas ma dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cognition that has the object of engagement is not perceived because it is not manifest.

original: de rtogs pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The realization of that is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: der gyur pa na yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'jug pa ni thugs rje'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: der gyur pa na yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'jug pa ni thugs rje'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: And when that occurs, the engagement of the Buddhas is by the power of compassion.

original: yang na skad cig gi rang bzhin gyi shes pa rtogs kyang thugs rje'i dbang gis rang gi rgyud gnas par bya ba'i don du spyod pa 'jug pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na skad cig gi rang bzhin gyi shes pa rtogs kyang thugs rje'i dbang gis rang gi rgyud gnas par bya ba'i don du spyod pa 'jug pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or else, even though the cognition is momentary by nature, it is engaged in conduct by the power of compassion, in order to maintain its own continuum.

original: gang gis de skad brjod /
analyzed: gang gis de skad brjod /
translated: By whom is it said?

original: ci de ltar 'jug pa mthong ngam zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: ci de ltar 'jug pa mthong ngam zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Anticipating the doubt, â€œIs such engagement seen?,â€ he says:

original: ci ltar rgyal po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rgyal po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œJust as the king, etc.â€

original: skye dgu bsrung ba'i bsam pa can gyi rgyal po ni rgas pas bdag nyid 'chi bar rtogs pa na yul de la bdag nyid bsrung bar mthong yang de'i don du bu la sogs pa 'bad pas rnam par gzhag pa'i don du brtson pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: skye dgu bsrung ba'i bsam pa can gyi rgyal po ni rgas pas bdag nyid 'chi bar rtogs pa na yul de la bdag nyid bsrung bar mthong yang de'i don du bu la sogs pa 'bad pas rnam par gzhag pa'i don du brtson pa de bzhin du /
translated: The king, who has the intention to protect living beings, when he realizes that he himself is dying due to old age, sees that he himself is to be protected in that country, and for that purpose, he strives to establish his son, etc. by effort.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang thugs rjes rang gi rgyun gnas don du 'bad pas mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang thugs rjes rang gi rgyun gnas don du 'bad pas mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, the Lord also, by the power of compassion, strives to maintain his own continuum.

original: des na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsams pa'i sku tshe mngon par 'grub pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsams pa'i sku tshe mngon par 'grub pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because he possesses the accumulation of merit that accomplishes the life-span conceived in three incalculable aeons,

original: bcom ldan 'das la ltos pa kho nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ltos pa kho nas /
translated: in dependence on the Lord

original: yang na las kyi yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na las kyi yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'thad pa yin no //
translated: it is tenable to think that the life-span is the result of karma.

original: 'dod pa'i rjes su ston pa yang bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rjes su ston pa yang bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The teaching of the desire realm is also the result of merit.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das ni mtha' med pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das ni mtha' med pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement that the Lord is infinite

original: smon lam gtso bor byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam gtso bor byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is called â€œthe preeminence of aspiration.â€

original: mtha' @214b med par gnas pa'i chun grub pa nyid las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' @214b med par gnas pa'i chun grub pa nyid las kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The establishment of the infinite life-span is the result of karma.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par spyad pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par spyad pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because in the ultimate sense there is no such thing as â€œpractice,â€ therefore it is said that â€œsuch a oneâ€ and so on.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni bdag ni sdug bsngal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig nyid du sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni bdag ni sdug bsngal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig nyid du sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The phrase in that way refers to the superimposition of a single entity, such as I am suffering.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The phrase if it were refers to the opponent's position.
